commit_message:
[tests] initialize client objects inside setUp

All tests from contrib dir inizialize fakeclient at module level.
It is bad practice and we should do preparatory steps at setUp method.

Change-Id: I2dd2988cd015d1dfb576fe004cb9461b02b55db3

subject: Remove deprecated volume(snapshot) commands/bindings
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-03 18:05:28.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/volume_types.py', 'novaclient/base.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_extended_attributes.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_service_catalog.py', 'novaclient/v2/volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_volumes_api.py', 'releasenotes/notes/volume-cli-removal-ffcb94421a356042.yaml', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_servers.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_volumes_api.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'novaclient/v2/volume_snapshots.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_volumes.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_instances.py', 'novaclient/v2/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_readonly_nova.py'], 'message': 'Remove deprecated volume(snapshot) commands/bindings

23f13437dd64496fcbc138bbaa9b0ac615a3cf23 deprecated the
purely volume or volume-snapshot related CLIs and python
API bindings during Kilo. python-cinderclient should be
used for the python API bindings now, and python-openstackclient
should be used for the CLI for those operations.

The alternate_service_type context manager is also removed
since it was only used for proxying through to the volume API
endpoint.

Since the proxy for creating volumes is removed, we have to
add python-cinderclient for testing the volume attachment
CLIs/APIs that are left intact.

Change-Id: I09a6501603667350f49b1b1fa130353a6d5272a2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated volume(snapshot) commands/bindings

23f13437dd64496fcbc138bbaa9b0ac615a3cf23 deprecated the
purely volume or volume-snapshot related CLIs and python
API bindings during Kilo. python-cinderclient should be
used for the python API bindings now, and python-openstackclient
should be used for the CLI for those operations.

The alternate_service_type context manager is also removed
since it was only used for proxying through to the volume API
endpoint.

Since the proxy for creating volumes is removed, we have to
add python-cinderclient for testing the volume attachment
CLIs/APIs that are left intact.

Change-Id: I09a6501603667350f49b1b1fa130353a6d5272a2

commit_message:
Fix puppet version for noop tests

During noop run the latest version of puppet is installed even if
initial Gemfile has a specific version as bundler looks for Gemfiles
recursively.

Fuel-CI: disable
Closes-Bug: 1565007

Change-Id: Ie39a556bed6d5db1e9b0334953ec9cc94746a169
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

subject: Prevent transfer tables expanding out of modal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 12:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_transfer_tables.scss'], 'message': 'Prevent transfer tables expanding out of modal

The transfer tables can sometimes expand out of the modal when they have
columns containing very long UUID entries, which is common for Networks/
Subnets. We should force word-break to prevent this.

Change-Id: I65fece6139010b128f8b60e3a53e0b5ac7b82edb
Closes-Bug: 1565724
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent transfer tables expanding out of modal

The transfer tables can sometimes expand out of the modal when they have
columns containing very long UUID entries, which is common for Networks/
Subnets. We should force word-break to prevent this.

Change-Id: I65fece6139010b128f8b60e3a53e0b5ac7b82edb
Closes-Bug: 1565724

subject: Fix the driver shutdown/failover logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/eventloop.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/driver.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/test_amqp_driver.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/controller.py'], 'message': 'Fix the driver shutdown/failover logic

Re-work much of the shutdown/failover logic.  Failover due to a broker
hang or broker-initiated shutdown works properly and new unit tests
have been added for these cases. The shutdown code has been fixed to
correctly shutdown the background thread and release resources.
Socket failure and link failure handling has been improved.  Fork
handling code works properly.

Closes-Bug: #1554046
Change-Id: I5aea2f8212e60964fb78eae30078fcf672d7f447
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the driver shutdown/failover logic

Re-work much of the shutdown/failover logic.  Failover due to a broker
hang or broker-initiated shutdown works properly and new unit tests
have been added for these cases. The shutdown code has been fixed to
correctly shutdown the background thread and release resources.
Socket failure and link failure handling has been improved.  Fork
handling code works properly.

Closes-Bug: #1554046
Change-Id: I5aea2f8212e60964fb78eae30078fcf672d7f447

commit_message:
Remove outdated line in KMIP docstring

In the KMIPSecretStore, there was an outdated docstring that
mentioned the only supported object types are symmetric and
asymmetric keys. This is not true anymore, so this line should
be removed.

Change-Id: Id563fa0fc17571fd508fef6b83bcc21b7672d880

commit_message:
Fix CheckBoxMixin:is_marked behavior

is_marked method of CheckBoxMixin was returned False always because it
worked with <label> element instead of corresponding <input>

Closes-Bug: #1561904

commit_message:
VMware: Use Port Group and Key in binding details

This uses the port group and port key information passed
via the binding:vif_details attribute, if available. This
allows these parameters to be passed explicitly.

Change-Id: I41949e8134c2ca860e7b7ad3a2679b9f2884a99a
Closes-Bug: #1552786

commit_message:
Drop keystone eventlet support

Keystone has dropped support for running under eventlet (using
keystone-all).

Change-Id: Ib38c0b1a54633a6b6dfa3a0a605cd2b02ca48989

commit_message:
Add out-of-band RAID configuration support for Cisco Hardware

This blueprint adds support for RAID configuration on Cisco UCS Manager
managed UCS B/C/M-series servers using out-of-band method. UcsSdk
exposes interface for RAID configuration via OOB, this proposal uses
this interface and adds RAID configuration support for UCS drivers.

Change-Id: Iceb7033355c7b5054cdc9036a88d9e9ad79e9018

Change-Id: I5a93788c01fcd2f9b18959b309878de89a0f6526

commit_message:
Add parse.unquote in TransportURL to support special chars

Add parse.unquote in TransportURL.parse to support special chars
in username and password, others could quote the username & password
, then send the quoted url to TransportURL.parse.

Change-Id: I5a93788c01fcd2f9b18959b309878de89a0f6526
Closes-Bug: #1557496

commit_message:
Fix mysql hash lookup for deep hash merge

hiera_hash('mysql_hash') only pulls in the
mysql_hash from globals.yaml, ignoring the
'mysql' hash that exists in plugins.

This is part of a fix that will align all hash
storage and lookups to not contain '_hash' suffix.

Change-Id: Id74f6b31107f8939f185b3832c897d3dff7197f9
Partial-Bug: #1526917
(cherry picked from commit d73af357ce11bc2f5b1d6c4bdd0f8f5d43c56bb0)
(cherry picked from commit d008eaf5de51ba4b19f4b15baf11ae91fe51a713)

revisions:

The read_file method in trove.guestagent.common.operating_system
currently do not support reading binary data into base 64
encoded strings. A new codec needs to be added to support such

Change-Id: Ibefc56688484c9f4a929ecb8cc1fb9fa28c7af64
Closes-Bug: 1551461
'}]
commit_message:
read_file method do not support base 64 encoding

The read_file method in trove.guestagent.common.operating_system
currently do not support reading binary data into base 64
encoded strings. A new codec needs to be added to support such
operation.

Change-Id: Ibefc56688484c9f4a929ecb8cc1fb9fa28c7af64
Closes-Bug: 1551461

commit_message:
Development velocity: Reduce tests run time

For context, please see the openstack-dev thread titled:
[All][Neutron] Improving development and review velocity -
Is it time for a drastic change?

As part of a new cross-project effort to increase development
velocity, I as Neutron's testing lieutenant propose that
we move to a new model: A model of trust. Neutron will follow
Python's canonical "We're all adults" philosophy, as well
as PEP20 (Commonly known as the Zen of Python).

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0020/

Change-Id: Ib1a0b3869a686617daae7c107ed8a5441675f247

commit_message:
Development velocity: Reduce review time

For context, please see the openstack-dev thread titled:
[All][Neutron] Improving development and review velocity -
Is it time for a drastic change?

Neutron has had a review velocity issue since the beginning
of time. We've split off *aaS, core plugins and ML2 drivers,
and introduced the lieutenants system.

Now it's time for out of the box thinking. I hereby propose
that we alter the idea of the core reviewer: Instead of
moving in to the role, everyone will start as a core reviewer.
For more information, please see the email thread.

Change-Id: I4428b5397e9ac4389cc8d12a8340addb6ca68073

commit_message:
Improved search for unlocked system accounts

This patch adds a better check for system accounts that aren't
unlocked. The new logic meets the requirement of V-38496 from the
STIG better than the previous version. Only unlocked accounts with
UID < 500 will trigger the failure/violation.

Closes-Bug: 1550442

Change-Id: I18ccbd8e1cd7c311521d0ffdfcf6f46dbc4e395d

commit_message:
MockKeyManager create_key change key_length to length

MockKeyManager was using kwarg key_length, but this is not what is
specified by the key manager interface.  The proper name for the
kward should be 'length'.

Change-Id: I3b7685363e24a9c71b9019ee94c4b2842d2a95de

commit_message:
Allow fetching IPA ramdisk with branch name

This adds branch name to the default URLs for IPA images, ensuring that
devstack runs will use the correct branch of IPA for tests.

It introduces a variable IPA_DOWNLOAD_BRANCH to accomplish this, which
defaults to master. This default will be set to the branch name on
stable branches, e.g. stable/mitaka. It is modified to match our URL
scheme for agent images, e.g. stable-mitaka.

This cherry-pick is modified to set the default to stable/mitaka.

Change-Id: I3ec6dafb9522b5fe79e0c6681c2578d2a723380a
Closes-Bug: #1561756
(cherry picked from commit 8e15d6a1388f49026c4d35ba87219a49ccc3c134)

commit_message:
scenario003: enable SSL by default

This patch enables SSL by default on scenario003 for both Ubuntu &
CentOS7, like it's done for scenario001 and 002.

Note: we don't enable SSL for Sahara because of:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1565082

Change-Id: I7e25b8acaeda2fc51a1a83b3a3aae0c89f332323

commit_message:
update tarball-base settings for mitaka

Update the tarball-base settings for projects that publish a tarball
using a name that doesn't match their repository. Also disable the links
entirely in projects with non-standard or missing builds until we can
add a mode to let us link to those artifacts or remove the projects.

Change-Id: I817a5021c3dc38acdad512568e669968f1571539
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-04-04 11:07:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst', 'gnocchi/storage/ceph.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'ceph: make requirements clearer

This improves documentation about ceph requirements.

And this creates two new extra requirements to inform packagers
about rados libs requirements, even this is not really usefull for
our virtualenv setup.

* ceph-pre-jewel: For when Ceph version is < jewel (10.1.0)
* ceph-jewel-and-later: For when Ceph version is >= jewel

Change-Id: I75bb096d8ede2e1e0076d22eaeac5eabc1c03ded
'}]
commit_message:
ceph: make requirements clearer

This improves documentation about ceph requirements.

And this creates two new extra requirements to inform packagers
about rados libs requirements, even this is not really usefull for
our virtualenv setup.

* ceph-pre-jewel: For when Ceph version is < jewel (10.1.0)
* ceph-jewel-and-later: For when Ceph version is >= jewel

Change-Id: I75bb096d8ede2e1e0076d22eaeac5eabc1c03ded

commit_message:
Validate MTU on DPDK enabled interface

According [0] DPDK works only with 1500 MTU. This patch adds MTU
validation for API.

[0] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/a5e9c53/INSTALL.DPDK.md#restrictions

Change-Id: Ia2ba02c16a4e0493f3395cf74eb0e279fe274513
Partial-Bug: 1560479

All other clouds have node name convention of $provider-$region where

Change-Id: I1df835cf9e9e7e35fc95911b244791bfb685afd4

commit_message:
rename vexxhost to match existing conventions

All other clouds have node name convention of $provider-$region where
neither provider nor region have '-' in them. The vexxhost entries
were added differently.

Change-Id: I1df835cf9e9e7e35fc95911b244791bfb685afd4

commit_message:
Disable logging to console

Anyway logs are not split between stdout and stderr. All were sent to
console.

Change-Id: I6039017ed6b3d72b268759a7bbc76f1b306109cf
Closes-bug: #1549216

commit_message:
Rename ironic to neutronic

Now that we're part of the neutron stadium, we should change our name
for greater synergystic alignment with the rest of our global community.

Change-Id: I1f141aa265c9cac475ed768cc6f8cc3b2fd4fc3b
Depends-On: I2c3df4a7f7108f532edea85a3939c72740cdeeb8

subject: Use Neutron master for DevStack and testing, instead of Liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-04 10:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['_test-requirements.txt', 'devstack/bootstrap.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Use Neutron master for DevStack and testing, instead of Liberty

This change modifies networking-calico's requirements and DevStack setup
so as to use master Neutron code instead of stable/liberty.

DevStack bootstrap script changes:

- Use master DevStack by default (which means using master of all
  OpenStack code), but support arbitrary devstack branch via the new
  DEVSTACK_BRANCH variable.
- Change subnet CIDR from 10.65.0/24 to 10.65.0.0/24, as Neutron
  apparently now requires full length.

Test requirements:

- Use master Neutron code instead of stable/liberty.
- Hide test requirements from DevStack.  DevStack's installation of test
  requirements is currently failing [1], so avoid that by renaming the
  file.

  [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1540328

Change-Id: Ibd3cf57f31fa0b5b541fce1a14f0836edc606520
"}]
commit_message:
Use Neutron master for DevStack and testing, instead of Liberty

This change modifies networking-calico's requirements and DevStack setup
so as to use master Neutron code instead of stable/liberty.

DevStack bootstrap script changes:

- Use master DevStack by default (which means using master of all
  OpenStack code), but support arbitrary devstack branch via the new
  DEVSTACK_BRANCH variable.
- Change subnet CIDR from 10.65.0/24 to 10.65.0.0/24, as Neutron
  apparently now requires full length.

Test requirements:

- Use master Neutron code instead of stable/liberty.
- Hide test requirements from DevStack.  DevStack's installation of test
  requirements is currently failing [1], so avoid that by renaming the
  file.

  [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1540328

Change-Id: Ibd3cf57f31fa0b5b541fce1a14f0836edc606520

- Fixed positions for some icons
- Converted some icons from .ttf to .svg vector format

subject: Include reseller admin role correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 10:56:39.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Include reseller admin role correctly

The name of the reseller_admin_role in the proxy config needs
to map to the correct role within the deploy. It was specified
manually and inconsistently though a variable exists in the role
defaults.

Change-Id: Ib93fc57f1e26e8a0943a7bd7c2212ce94be54f7c
Closes-Bug: #1542391
(cherry picked from commit 486adbe215b1693e6627b4262c24ccf791c7b6e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Include reseller admin role correctly

The name of the reseller_admin_role in the proxy config needs
to map to the correct role within the deploy. It was specified
manually and inconsistently though a variable exists in the role
defaults.

Change-Id: Ib93fc57f1e26e8a0943a7bd7c2212ce94be54f7c
Closes-Bug: #1542391
(cherry picked from commit 486adbe215b1693e6627b4262c24ccf791c7b6e8)

subject: Adjust api_url for ironic to use ironic_api VIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 05:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Adjust api_url for ironic to use ironic_api VIP

This PR changes the api_url setting in ironic.conf to correctly use the
interal URL, for standalone ironic installs.

Previously this used the hosts IP address, which would mean each host
specified it's own IP address causing issues connecting to the ironic
API hosts instead of the conductor hosts.

Change-Id: Ib70484c49eed2f2160d12607b4574c81e24e22f9
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust api_url for ironic to use ironic_api VIP

This PR changes the api_url setting in ironic.conf to correctly use the
interal URL, for standalone ironic installs.

Previously this used the hosts IP address, which would mean each host
specified it's own IP address causing issues connecting to the ironic
API hosts instead of the conductor hosts.

Change-Id: Ib70484c49eed2f2160d12607b4574c81e24e22f9

commit_message:
update constraints on pillow for CVE-2016-{0740,0775}

Pillow 3.1.0 and earlier when linked against libtiff >= 4.0.0 on x64
may overflow a buffer when reading a specially crafted tiff file.

https://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=573958 for refrence

subject: allow --check-tmpdir arg to be configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 15:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/images/build/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/images/build/tasks/undercloud_inject.yml'], 'message': 'allow --check-tmpdir arg to be configurable

Addresses: https://github.com/redhat-openstack/tripleo-quickstart/issues/66

virt-sparsify checks to see if there is enough space using an estimate based on the
virtual size of the disk (40G in our case). The actual size is substantially smaller.
The default behavior for virt-sparsify is "warn" - which in this context will cause
the shell task to hang forever waiting for a CR to ack the warning.  We presently use
"fail" which is the safest option and will never cause a nasty failure due to a volume
that is completely filled up.  This change permits a pragmatic middle ground, where
we still default to the safe option (fail) but allow for pragmatism (I have 20G free
but not 40....do it anyway).

Change-Id: I78263f6ac06f3184afb3ae7339b2ee3f40d282ec
'}]
commit_message:
allow --check-tmpdir arg to be configurable

Addresses: https://github.com/redhat-openstack/tripleo-quickstart/issues/66

virt-sparsify checks to see if there is enough space using an estimate based on the
virtual size of the disk (40G in our case). The actual size is substantially smaller.
The default behavior for virt-sparsify is "warn" - which in this context will cause
the shell task to hang forever waiting for a CR to ack the warning.  We presently use
"fail" which is the safest option and will never cause a nasty failure due to a volume
that is completely filled up.  This change permits a pragmatic middle ground, where
we still default to the safe option (fail) but allow for pragmatism (I have 20G free
but not 40....do it anyway).

Change-Id: I78263f6ac06f3184afb3ae7339b2ee3f40d282ec

subject: Delete stale df db objects when neutron db transaction failed
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-28 12:40:52.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Delete stale df db objects when neutron db transaction failed

This problem is discovered during nested core plugin api.
When the parent transaction failed, the neutron db is rolled back,
but the df db is committed.

A delete function needs to be called to remove the stale objects
in the df db and keep the db consistency.

Change-Id: Ie72bf5e7a678885d533d45fc2c96bfda866775a3
Closes-Bug: #1558881
'}]
commit_message:
Delete stale df db objects when neutron db transaction failed

This problem is discovered during nested core plugin api.
When the parent transaction failed, the neutron db is rolled back,
but the df db is committed.

A delete function needs to be called to remove the stale objects
in the df db and keep the db consistency.

Change-Id: Ie72bf5e7a678885d533d45fc2c96bfda866775a3
Closes-Bug: #1558881

subject: Add default values for domain related options
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-04 10:57:47.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/test_auth.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add default values for domain related options

Keystone V3 requires that the options os_user_domain_id/os_user_domain_name
and os_project_domain_id/os_project_domain_name be set. These options do not
have default values and novaclient will fail if they are not set by user.

This patch adds default values for os_project_domain_id and
os_user_domain_id in case of Keystone V3 env.
This is consistent with what the OpenStack CLI does.

Also, two functional tests are added to check authentication via
Keystone V2 and V3.

Partial-Bug: #1522402

Change-Id: Ieb41a7fbf24107f7250ef34218604fba96531195
'}]
commit_message:
Add default values for domain related options

Keystone V3 requires that the options os_user_domain_id/os_user_domain_name
and os_project_domain_id/os_project_domain_name be set. These options do not
have default values and novaclient will fail if they are not set by user.

This patch adds default values for os_project_domain_id and
os_user_domain_id in case of Keystone V3 env.
This is consistent with what the OpenStack CLI does.

Also, two functional tests are added to check authentication via
Keystone V2 and V3.

Partial-Bug: #1522402

Change-Id: Ieb41a7fbf24107f7250ef34218604fba96531195

commit_message:
Don't use IPv6 DNS servers for the Fuel

Fuel don't support IPv6 yet, so we shouldn't use IPv6 DNS servers
from the local /etc/resolv.conf.

Change-Id: Ia6ec6bf0bf3c100c591f82cd9b8785a00e93f016
(cherry-picked from 12abb6b07ce772478045d3d015e5af87390e604a)
Closes-Bug: #1553568

Add Service.get_minimum_version_multi() for multiple binaries

This is an optimization to make it faster to look up a bunch of
service versions.

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.compute_node_statistics() method is being
called directly from the os-hosts API extension. This patch fixes up the
SQLAlchemy-fu to properly aggregate returned results when some compute
nodes have been migrated to the new resource-providers database schema.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Partially-implements: compute-node-inventory-newton

Change-Id: I137266e4fa152c3916cb5196fb15b12c18a19886
'}]
commit_message:
Make compute_node_statistics() use new schema

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.compute_node_statistics() method is being
called directly from the os-hosts API extension. This patch fixes up the
SQLAlchemy-fu to properly aggregate returned results when some compute
nodes have been migrated to the new resource-providers database schema.

Co-Authored-By: Ed Leafe <ed@leafe.com>

Partially-implements: compute-node-inventory-newton

Change-Id: I137266e4fa152c3916cb5196fb15b12c18a19886

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 12:08:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/baremetal_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Fix error message of nova baremetal-node-delete

When execute "nova baremetal-node-delete" command,
below error message is shown:
 ERROR (BadRequest): Command Not supported.
 Please use Ironic command port-create to perform this action. (HTTP 400)

Ironic command corresponds to nova baremetal-node-delete is
not port-create, but node-delete.
This patch set fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I065e1efdce7a82d25d6d68908b0b1c43e6be7000
Closes-bug: #1564872
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error message of nova baremetal-node-delete

When execute "nova baremetal-node-delete" command,
below error message is shown:
 ERROR (BadRequest): Command Not supported.
 Please use Ironic command port-create to perform this action. (HTTP 400)

Ironic command corresponds to nova baremetal-node-delete is
not port-create, but node-delete.
This patch set fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I065e1efdce7a82d25d6d68908b0b1c43e6be7000
Closes-bug: #1564872

commit_message:
Update config samples to show Identity v3 params

As Designate requests its service token using Identity v3, the
config.sample and some docs should reflect this. This patch updates
these files in order to conform to new v3 parameters.

Change-Id: I3205751f0c818f85ffe2fbb2468c6c48fd27eb91

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/engine.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_engine_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Revise keystone/trusts config to avoid deprecated options

There are some inter-related changes required to avoid using legacy
fallback/deprecated paths in heat, which result in warnings in the
Heat log, e.g because we fall-back to reusing keystone auth_token
configuration instead of heat specific sections.

To fix this:
- Don't explicitly set deferred_auth_method=trusts, as this is now
  the default (since kilo). So switch to $::os_service_default.
- Create a new "trustee" section containing configuration used for
  the password auth-plugin associated with deferred authentication
  via trusts (support for this was added during liberty to enable
  us to stop incorrectly using the keystone auth_token config)
- Create a "clients_keystone" section to avoid falling back to the
  legacy behavior of stealing the uri from auth_token.

Change-Id: I51c3e28abb7d5166ae9622cfb747eab8e327b149
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Revise keystone/trusts config to avoid deprecated options

There are some inter-related changes required to avoid using legacy
fallback/deprecated paths in heat, which result in warnings in the
Heat log, e.g because we fall-back to reusing keystone auth_token
configuration instead of heat specific sections.

To fix this:
- Don't explicitly set deferred_auth_method=trusts, as this is now
  the default (since kilo). So switch to $::os_service_default.
- Create a new "trustee" section containing configuration used for
  the password auth-plugin associated with deferred authentication
  via trusts (support for this was added during liberty to enable
  us to stop incorrectly using the keystone auth_token config)
- Create a "clients_keystone" section to avoid falling back to the
  legacy behavior of stealing the uri from auth_token.

Change-Id: I51c3e28abb7d5166ae9622cfb747eab8e327b149
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Restart rsyslogd after logrotate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-31 23:16:05.000000000', 'files': ['templates/os_aggregate_storage.j2'], 'message': 'Restart rsyslogd after logrotate

The copytruncate directive in logrotate configuration truncates the log file so
that processes can keep using the same file descriptor to write to the log
file. The truncation, however, does not work well with rsyslog forwarding as
rsyslog fails to figure out the difference from last sent messages.

This change restarts rsyslogd in postrotate directive of logrotate such as
rsyslog will start with a new baseline and continue forwarding logs.

Closes-Bug: 1564654
Change-Id: Ied15bc73e5af78bfcc1430db787b61d65a9bc044
Signed-off-by: Shu Shen <sshen@siaras.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Restart rsyslogd after logrotate

The copytruncate directive in logrotate configuration truncates the log file so
that processes can keep using the same file descriptor to write to the log
file. The truncation, however, does not work well with rsyslog forwarding as
rsyslog fails to figure out the difference from last sent messages.

This change restarts rsyslogd in postrotate directive of logrotate such as
rsyslog will start with a new baseline and continue forwarding logs.

Closes-Bug: 1564654
Change-Id: Ied15bc73e5af78bfcc1430db787b61d65a9bc044
Signed-off-by: Shu Shen <sshen@siaras.com>

Merge "Set lxc_container_caches not to use repo_pip_default_index"
Apply host security hardening by default

Security hardening has been applied to all gate jobs since January
2016 in the Mitaka release. This patch enables security hardening
for all deployments in Newton by changing the
apply_security_hardening variable to true by default.

Depends-On: I18ccbd8e1cd7c311521d0ffdfcf6f46dbc4e395d
Change-Id: Icea0161200c598c65d9898bf5d63c49faa43ee69
'}]
commit_message:
Set lxc_container_caches not to use repo_pip_default_index

The LXC container cache may happen to use the same web server
as that set for the repo_pip_default_index but this is not an
assumption that should be made so readily.

This patch purposefully decouples these.

Change-Id: I9f8901d8c7f48a1de0511eb0ba1795a1db28405c

Merge "Set lxc_container_caches not to use repo_pip_default_index"
Apply host security hardening by default

Security hardening has been applied to all gate jobs since January
2016 in the Mitaka release. This patch enables security hardening
for all deployments in Newton by changing the
apply_security_hardening variable to true by default.

Depends-On: I18ccbd8e1cd7c311521d0ffdfcf6f46dbc4e395d
Change-Id: Icea0161200c598c65d9898bf5d63c49faa43ee69

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 15993, 'name': 'Amy Marrich', 'display_name': 'Amy Marrich (spotz)', 'email': 'amy@demarco.com', 'username': 'amarrich'}, {'_account_id': 19814, 'name': 'Travis Truman (automagically)', 'email': 'travis_truman@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'trumant'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-04 11:50:55.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_setup.yml', 'tasks/galera_upgrade_post.yml', 'tasks/galera_running_check.yml'], 'message': 'Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

This change adds a retry to the mysql_upgrade command when performing
an upgrade. This is required in circumstances when the wsrep service
is not ready for application use. This is a common issue when restarting
the mysql service after package installation.

Example Error:
  Got error: 1047: WSREP has not yet prepared node for application
  use when selecting the database

Change-Id: Icd859531b6a6f1e04ecd1214eb7c401fa0fe8048
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

This change adds a retry to the mysql_upgrade command when performing
an upgrade. This is required in circumstances when the wsrep service
is not ready for application use. This is a common issue when restarting
the mysql service after package installation.

Example Error:
  Got error: 1047: WSREP has not yet prepared node for application
  use when selecting the database

Change-Id: Icd859531b6a6f1e04ecd1214eb7c401fa0fe8048
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix module's import order

Made corrections in import order for built-in,third-party
and project specific modules as per openstack import
standards [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#import-order-template

commit_message:
made vertica debian package path configurable

In the INSTALL_VERTICA command the path for vertica debian package
is now configurable. This make it easy to build the image with
the package (even if the minor version changes) and one doesn't
need to change the name of the debian package being embeded in
the image

Closes-Bug: #1486866
Depends-On: I2863a21d186d9c809fa2fdb0050e4728e100b010

Change-Id: Ide0914ae6e10a53a174a12d7e80c21d49a450f4c

HBase standalone and HBase pseudo-distributed operation.

Users will be able to create (using elements provided in
trove-integration chkin (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262048/) an
HBase instance using the standard 'trove create' operation.

Once created, the operations supported at this stage include instance
and disk resize, restart, and backup. As noted in the blueprint,
backup will take a dump of the data after stopping the HBase
instance. At a later stage, a more sophisticated backup strategy can
be implemented.

Support is provided for interacting with the HBase instance using the
hbase shell, the Java API, a REST API and the Thrift API.

Change-Id: I246d92be2f3cb50cb0b258edc5a1c6a3c0eed35d
Depends-On: I52c68ad3b0ba1e029a1c616ce16b1b8ce5dca311
Depends-On: I49c8c0ffa8deb47ba2fad75bd75d014687f90692
Implements-Blueprint: hbase-support
DocImpact: Additional documentation about HBase support will be required
"}]
commit_message:
Initial chkin of Trove code for Apache HBase support

This commit provides source code for the first phase of HBase support
in OpenStack Trove. As described in the blueprint, this phase provides
HBase standalone and HBase pseudo-distributed operation.

Users will be able to create (using elements provided in
trove-integration chkin (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262048/) an
HBase instance using the standard 'trove create' operation.

Once created, the operations supported at this stage include instance
and disk resize, restart, and backup. As noted in the blueprint,
backup will take a dump of the data after stopping the HBase
instance. At a later stage, a more sophisticated backup strategy can
be implemented.

Support is provided for interacting with the HBase instance using the
hbase shell, the Java API, a REST API and the Thrift API.

Change-Id: I246d92be2f3cb50cb0b258edc5a1c6a3c0eed35d
Depends-On: I52c68ad3b0ba1e029a1c616ce16b1b8ce5dca311
Depends-On: I49c8c0ffa8deb47ba2fad75bd75d014687f90692
Implements-Blueprint: hbase-support
DocImpact: Additional documentation about HBase support will be required

commit_message:
Image elements and redstack changes for Apache HBase

This chkin represents the initial set of files for the
trove-integration project, relating to the addition of support for
Apache HBase in Trove.

New elements ubuntu-hbase-standalone and
ubuntu-hbase-pseudo-distributed are provided. Changes are made in
redstack and functions_qemu to accommodate these new elements. HBase
also requires an additional user (hadoop) which has its own
key-pair. That keypair is also provided.

Change-Id: I49c8c0ffa8deb47ba2fad75bd75d014687f90692
Depends-On: I52c68ad3b0ba1e029a1c616ce16b1b8ce5dca311
Implements-Blueprint: hbase-support
DocImpact: Additional documentation about HBase support will be required

subject: resample only data affected by new measures
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-04 11:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'message': 'resample only data affected by new measures

currently, we are passing in the full unaggregated timeserie
when we update each of the aggregates for each granularity.
this is incorrect as the unaggregated timeserie corresponds to the
largest granularity of the metric. this means that for smaller
granularities, we are updating and resampling points that are already
aggregated and not affected by new incoming measures.

Change-Id: I687c2a18b332494f5c5cb7fdfe6f2b3d1e8de804
Closes-Bug: #1562820
(cherry picked from commit 3bdfaeb67e7041a0ea541143bd3cfc697d8ab5d4)
'}]
commit_message:
resample only data affected by new measures

currently, we are passing in the full unaggregated timeserie
when we update each of the aggregates for each granularity.
this is incorrect as the unaggregated timeserie corresponds to the
largest granularity of the metric. this means that for smaller
granularities, we are updating and resampling points that are already
aggregated and not affected by new incoming measures.

Change-Id: I687c2a18b332494f5c5cb7fdfe6f2b3d1e8de804
Closes-Bug: #1562820
(cherry picked from commit 3bdfaeb67e7041a0ea541143bd3cfc697d8ab5d4)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-04 09:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/constants.py'], 'message': "Don't configure Nova v3 service

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work.

The /v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint.

What we called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in particular with the backwards-compat thing I mentioned earlier.

We keep the /v2 path in api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1 codepath (just not asking for microversions)

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/etc/nova/api-paste.ini#L18

In summary, we only need one endpoint, ie. /v2.1

Change-Id: Icdda1e08dd691aeca693725931709dcdc0efaf57
Related-Bug: #1564372
(cherry picked from commit 352a9f1567937e2fce08c65ffd29c399441238fc)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't configure Nova v3 service

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work.

The /v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint.

What we called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in particular with the backwards-compat thing I mentioned earlier.

We keep the /v2 path in api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1 codepath (just not asking for microversions)

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/etc/nova/api-paste.ini#L18

In summary, we only need one endpoint, ie. /v2.1

Change-Id: Icdda1e08dd691aeca693725931709dcdc0efaf57
Related-Bug: #1564372
(cherry picked from commit 352a9f1567937e2fce08c65ffd29c399441238fc)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-27 12:24:19.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/common/remote.py'], 'message': "Allow Trove to use insecure API for other services

If self-signed certificates are in use, you need to be able to inform
Trove that it should establish an insecure connection with those
services. Many OpenStack services support this by passing an insecure
argument to the HTTPClient.

This change adds new configuration options:

nova_api_insecure,
neutron_api_insecure,
cinder_api_insecure,
swift_api_insecure, and
api_insecure

Each of the first four determine whether or not the API's for those
services is insecure (default=False). The fifth one indicates that all
of them are insecure (default=False).

You could therefore choose to turn on insecure on just one of the
services, or easily enable it for all services that Trove accesses.

Change-Id: I26212098fdbabd479de645c42c584f378d498b17
Closes-Bug: #1535895
Doc-Impact: Trove now supports self-signed certificates for other services.
"}]
commit_message:
Allow Trove to use insecure API for other services

If self-signed certificates are in use, you need to be able to inform
Trove that it should establish an insecure connection with those
services. Many OpenStack services support this by passing an insecure
argument to the HTTPClient.

This change adds new configuration options:

nova_api_insecure,
neutron_api_insecure,
cinder_api_insecure,
swift_api_insecure, and
api_insecure

Each of the first four determine whether or not the API's for those
services is insecure (default=False). The fifth one indicates that all
of them are insecure (default=False).

You could therefore choose to turn on insecure on just one of the
services, or easily enable it for all services that Trove accesses.

Change-Id: I26212098fdbabd479de645c42c584f378d498b17
Closes-Bug: #1535895
Doc-Impact: Trove now supports self-signed certificates for other services.

commit_message:
Handling of ephemeral methods was fixed

Ephemeral method is the one that created
on the fly and doesn't belong to extension
class. Such methods were returned as a replacement
for ambiguous methods. Such ephemeral method
would throw exception upon attempt to invoke it so that
we get this exception on run-time rather that load-time.
However yaql FunctionDefinition code wasn't ready for
such functions

Change-Id: Ica8585b9750277d29f571b90dc7b92e12e5fef30
Closes-Bug: #1562011

commit_message:
Simplify new project criteria.

The move to the "big tent" has made OpenStack much more inclusive.  Some
complain that the bar is too high.  Let's simplify things by only
requiring that a project desires to be a part of OpenStack.  That alone
should be enough to verify that a project is "one of us".

Change-Id: I876f2ec07956f0ce8f13b850cafc401ccc4446eb

subject: Pass environment variables of proxy to tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 02:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is
a new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: I15615bd3e789a580e3f25f25228851b78197e7a7
'}]
commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is
a new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: I15615bd3e789a580e3f25f25228851b78197e7a7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 18:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_hooks.py'], 'message': "WIP: example code to try to test hooks

This code doesn't work, however it's a first sketch about how hooks
testing could be done if we were going to do it at a full stack
level. It doesn't actually work because the try around hook processing
is so broad it catches and rolls over the assert.

Uploaded to gerrit for historical reasons in case we ever want to
revive this.

commit_message:
WIP: example code to try to test hooks

This code doesn't work, however it's a first sketch about how hooks
testing could be done if we were going to do it at a full stack
level. It doesn't actually work because the try around hook processing
is so broad it catches and rolls over the assert.

Uploaded to gerrit for historical reasons in case we ever want to
revive this.

Change-Id: If72e0c74472d9e5d00791e06d07adafc33b9b975

commit_message:
Update test dependencies

This commit installs libffi-dev on neutron hosts, and updates the nova
test dependencies to install on all nova hosts.  This is not causing
gate failures as I believe these packages may already be installed on
the host, and they already exist in containers which is why they do not
fail there.

Change-Id: I5a74b313642a1b1c5a6ae8dcb2b883d920b68134

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 23:18:08.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add the galera_client dependency to the repo build

This change is required because without it the client libraries
used to build the MySQL-Python packages will depend on the base
system and they will be wrong.

This is an example of the issue:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/492788/

This will cause multi node production issues when building a
standalong repository outside of the the OpenStack gate.

Closes-Bug: #1565128
Change-Id: I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add the galera_client dependency to the repo build

This change is required because without it the client libraries
used to build the MySQL-Python packages will depend on the base
system and they will be wrong.

This is an example of the issue:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/492788/

This will cause multi node production issues when building a
standalong repository outside of the the OpenStack gate.

Closes-Bug: #1565128
Change-Id: I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-12 12:27:48.000000000', 'files': ['tools/osctime.py'], 'message': "osc timing utility

This small script parses a devstack log and accounts for the time
spent running the openstack client. In a current run this is 4.5
minutes. While many of these calls are rest calls, and that's where
the time is, the fact that 1/3 of our setup time is inside OSC seems
problematic.

Change-Id: Idd5bb9b497bd791d70e6df270c196efa011617dc
"}]
commit_message:
osc timing utility

This small script parses a devstack log and accounts for the time
spent running the openstack client. In a current run this is 4.5
minutes. While many of these calls are rest calls, and that's where
the time is, the fact that 1/3 of our setup time is inside OSC seems
problematic.

Change-Id: Idd5bb9b497bd791d70e6df270c196efa011617dc

subject: Force rebuild of ramdisk as part of overcloud-full
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 21:31:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/overcloud-full/post-install.d/90-rebuild-ramdisk'], 'message': "Force rebuild of ramdisk as part of overcloud-full

If we don't do this, then a number of modules will be missing from
the image's ramdisk.  One example is the multipath module - this
has a dependency on device-mapper-multipath, which is installed as
part of the image build.  However, by default the ramdisk is not
rebuilt after the package is installed so it never takes effect.

This is the particular case I'm trying to address because it
prevents deploying to diskless systems that use iscsi targets as
their root disks.  With this change, the necessary modules for such
a deployment will be in the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I3c6a94070ebba39896d00250a14b655969406459
"}]
commit_message:
Force rebuild of ramdisk as part of overcloud-full

If we don't do this, then a number of modules will be missing from
the image's ramdisk.  One example is the multipath module - this
has a dependency on device-mapper-multipath, which is installed as
part of the image build.  However, by default the ramdisk is not
rebuilt after the package is installed so it never takes effect.

This is the particular case I'm trying to address because it
prevents deploying to diskless systems that use iscsi targets as
their root disks.  With this change, the necessary modules for such
a deployment will be in the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I3c6a94070ebba39896d00250a14b655969406459

subject: Enable galera replication for Mariadb 10.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 12:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Enable galera replication for Mariadb 10.1

The generated galera config has to include additional settings for
galera to be active on MariaDB 10.1.

wsrep_on must be explicitely set to ON. On MariaDB 5.5, this was
implicitely set as soon as wsrep_provider was specified.

a valid wsrep_cluster_address must be configured in addition to
wsrep_on, otherwise recovery command mysqld_safe --wsrep-recover
cannot retrieve replication state, and cluster cannot be bootstrapped.

These explicit settings are backward compatible with MariaDB 5.5 since
the two variables exist in both versions of MariaDB.

Change-Id: I4ab4f4eeb8679899f194399ba8695155e9a2f4a5
Closes-Bug: 1563751
'}]
commit_message:
Enable galera replication for Mariadb 10.1

The generated galera config has to include additional settings for
galera to be active on MariaDB 10.1.

wsrep_on must be explicitely set to ON. On MariaDB 5.5, this was
implicitely set as soon as wsrep_provider was specified.

a valid wsrep_cluster_address must be configured in addition to
wsrep_on, otherwise recovery command mysqld_safe --wsrep-recover
cannot retrieve replication state, and cluster cannot be bootstrapped.

These explicit settings are backward compatible with MariaDB 5.5 since
the two variables exist in both versions of MariaDB.

Change-Id: I4ab4f4eeb8679899f194399ba8695155e9a2f4a5
Closes-Bug: 1563751

revisions:

Fuel CI builds packages not from sdist, but from result of 'git archive',
so PBR doesn't have a chance to generate proper MANIFEST.in for us.
That's why we have to have proper MANIFEST.in in-tree as well.

Change-Id: Iead8053ca3f94b7999c737902281ecae5253f870
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MANIFEST.in to inlcude migrations

Fuel CI builds packages not from sdist, but from result of 'git archive',
so PBR doesn't have a chance to generate proper MANIFEST.in for us.
That's why we have to have proper MANIFEST.in in-tree as well.

Change-Id: Iead8053ca3f94b7999c737902281ecae5253f870

commit_message:
Deprecate "baremetal show capabilities" command

This command was introduced to display node profiles. This job is now better
done by the "overcloud profiles list" command. As a result, this command is not
covered by our documentation at all.

Also, Ironic will have its own API and commands for handling capabilities
reasonably soon, so we risk clashing with them.

Change-Id: I423a03801280b9f9614214a7b8a615e8056b9b25

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-22 18:29:40.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/novaclient-api-microversions.rst'], 'message': 'Update novaclient-api-microversions spec

This patch clarifies some particular actions, which were changed while
implementation or which were missed from original revision of the spec.

Also, sub-section "latest" is moved from "python-novaclient as a Python lib"
to "python-novaclient as CLI tool", since only CLI layer supports "latest"
version and novaclient-as-a-lib accepts only a specific version.

'}]
commit_message:
Update novaclient-api-microversions spec

This patch clarifies some particular actions, which were changed while
implementation or which were missed from original revision of the spec.

Also, sub-section "latest" is moved from "python-novaclient as a Python lib"
to "python-novaclient as CLI tool", since only CLI layer supports "latest"
version and novaclient-as-a-lib accepts only a specific version.

Change-Id: Id91ec32fb384a1d6e1cc43df89b9fe4e6e47dbae

subject: base: ensure list of changes is sorted for stability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 11:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'base: ensure list of changes is sorted for stability

The versioned_object.changes field in the dict returned by
obj_to_primitive() is built from a list of keys from a hash
table. As such the ordering of keys is nondeterministic
based on the python hash seed value. Sort it to ensure fields
are always reported in alphabetical order.

Related-bug: #1552676
Change-Id: I97aab24db132c33661fde74dca57db36c4ed6767
'}]
commit_message:
base: ensure list of changes is sorted for stability

The versioned_object.changes field in the dict returned by
obj_to_primitive() is built from a list of keys from a hash
table. As such the ordering of keys is nondeterministic
based on the python hash seed value. Sort it to ensure fields
are always reported in alphabetical order.

Related-bug: #1552676
Change-Id: I97aab24db132c33661fde74dca57db36c4ed6767

commit_message:
Upgrades: Add post-upgrade stack update

Upgrades require a set of post-upgrade steps (like unpinning Nova) so
this enables the environment that performs these steps.

commit_message:
Upgrades: Add initialization to StackUpgradeManager

The stack upgrade requires an initialization prior to the actual
performance of the upgrade. This adds an way to run with the
environment file that kicks off that init step.

Change-Id: Ib392a1ef0a392b9316088c93c122c06124e97dd1
(cherry picked from commit f74767d5398f87ad30a8531ac4f9adde7d6ab283)

commit_message:
Upgrades: Add 'stack upgrade' command

Adds a command to upgrade a stack. Takes similar parameters to
'deploy' command. The StackUpgradeManager from tripleo-common is
called to perform the actual upgrade. The command is
'openstack overcloud upgrade'.

Change-Id: Ifda39765704e7d98d1fb70882a4d31ee0c9de21d
Depends-On: Ib7fc5d544755d9b1ffbf46170602ec390e735c11
(cherry picked from commit 1b44a458b19ca56b3e42f952d65f59d3badca7a3)

commit_message:
Upgrades: Add finish stage to 'overcloud upgrade'

The overcloud upgrade will have cleanup to perform (like unpinning
Nova). This enables this to be run via the finish stage.

Change-Id: I4952b5d624b4d737a3b7485fff72d81502ea7695
Depends-On: I1b8fdf6bf817f2c2368607eff16f0e4e555fa0a8

commit_message:
Upgrades: Add initialization stage to 'overcloud upgrade'

This adds a call to the initialization for an overcloud upgrade.
Adds 'overcloud upgrade prepare' as a command option.

commit_message:
Add NetworkRequestList.from_tuples helper

We have duplicated logic in several places to convert a
legacy list of requested networks tuples into a
NetworkRequestList object. Let's just hide that in a helper
method in the object itself.

Change-Id: I301d34ada0af362ec0f8e809a99187ee13f9eb1b

commit_message:
[admin-guide] Add doc for Share Replication

The Shared File System service added new APIs to support
replication of shares. This commit adds examples of CLI
usage and description of some terminology and use-cases.

Change-Id: I464a1245f6a03c9707414fa7417e1c2cb94654c5

commit_message:
After migrate in-use volume the BDM information lost

This flag delete_on_termination is important for use,
but after the volume migration, this flag is the
hardcoded "false". It should be consistent with the
information on the migration before.

Closes-Bug: #1550250

Change-Id: Ifa1fb061df697f03893171a8c6ba96154ec8a29d

commit_message:
Set mandatory fields

icmp_code and icmp_type fields set to required.
Cleans both fields on rules that do not require them
so validation for other rules still work.

Closes-Bug: 1411566

Change-Id: Id88eaaf5f636854d19ead4e22df8adc625d21a4b
Signed-off-by: Itxaka <itxakaserrano@gmail.com>

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 19:52:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Add a hacking check for test method closures

A recurring pattern when using multiple mocks is to create a closure
decorated with mocks like:

    def test_thing(self):
            @mock.patch.object(self.compute, 'foo')
            @mock.patch.object(self.compute, 'bar')
            def _do_test(mock_bar, mock_foo):
                # Test things
        _do_test()

However it is easy to leave off the _do_test() and have the test pass
because nothing runs. This check looks for that pattern.

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Laski <andrew@lascii.com>
Change-Id: I4c2395a01470acc7c9e5bcf1d3578d00270a2c07
"}]

commit_message:
[zmq] Reduce number of connections

In this change 'use_router_proxy' option was added
to switch between direct connections and proxy.

Proxy was reimplemented and splitted onto two
types of proxies:

    * PUBLISHER proxy for fanout pattern
    * ROUTER proxy for direct messaging

Each type of proxy is configured over command line
argument --type.

Deployment guide was updated accordingly to the change.

Change-Id: If36e9c26e2a8ebe622cfa7e9f2a07b1a69aabe34
Closes-Bug: #1555007

commit_message:
Request for new repo - python-k8sclient

Split out Kubernetes client Magnum into a separate project. First
consumer is likely to be Magnum. We will be adding Magnum core
to the ACL so they can maintain it if they choose to. Please
add "dims-v" as the sole core member of the group. The idea is
to encourage other folks to contribute to this library as well
as allow Magnum cores a full say in the repo.

NOTE: this is not part of any official project at the moment,
so there is no governance review for this package.

Change-Id: I1472e631ec7f06e74e73c27edd68a1e2dc7b23e1

subject: Clean up deprecation warning in swift proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 22:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Clean up deprecation warning in swift proxy

The following warning appears in the swift proxy logs:
"Using the in-process token cache is deprecated as of the 4.2.0
release and may be removed in the 5.0.0 release or the 'O'
development cycle. The in-process cache causes inconsistent results
and high memory usage."

Specifying the location of a memcached server will not only clean up
a deprecation warning in the logs but should provide a performance
improvement.

This is caused by the absence of a memcached_servers key in the
proxy configuration. While this variable is defined as a group var
in the integrated release we insulate against the absense of this
value in stand-alone role usage or Swift Stand-Alone deploys which
may not include memcached yet to prevent upgrade impacts.

Change-Id: I0a16ef0030d1425f52b6c07214d7c8effef51c13
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up deprecation warning in swift proxy

The following warning appears in the swift proxy logs:
"Using the in-process token cache is deprecated as of the 4.2.0
release and may be removed in the 5.0.0 release or the 'O'
development cycle. The in-process cache causes inconsistent results
and high memory usage."

Specifying the location of a memcached server will not only clean up
a deprecation warning in the logs but should provide a performance
improvement.

This is caused by the absence of a memcached_servers key in the
proxy configuration. While this variable is defined as a group var
in the integrated release we insulate against the absense of this
value in stand-alone role usage or Swift Stand-Alone deploys which
may not include memcached yet to prevent upgrade impacts.

Change-Id: I0a16ef0030d1425f52b6c07214d7c8effef51c13

commit_message:
Add pip_get_pip_options to fall back Install PIP

We need to apply pip_get_pip_options to the fall back pip
installation so that arguments like --cert will be passed
during pip installation.

commit_message:
Include reseller admin role correctly

The name of the reseller_admin_role in the proxy config needs
to map to the correct role within the deploy. It was specified
manually and inconsistently though a variable exists in the role
defaults.

subject: Support master Neutron code (Mitaka) as well as previous releases
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-04-04 10:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/tests/test_interface_driver.py', 'networking_calico/tests/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'networking_calico/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'networking_calico/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'networking_calico/agent/linux/interface.py'], 'message': "Support master Neutron code (Mitaka) as well as previous releases

This change adapts networking-calico's code so that it works with the
Neutron master code, as well as continuing to work with Liberty and
previous OpenStack releases.  As we're now very close to the Mitaka
release, working with master Neutron code should also mean working
with the Mitaka release.

Handle removal of deprecated use_namespaces option:

- Don't override use_namespaces, as it no longer exists to be
  overridden.
- Handle new Mitaka NetModel calls that don't allow a use_namespaces
  argument, and set _ns_name attribute to get equivalent effect.
- Use subclassing to override pieces of the DHCP agent implementation
  that assume they own their own namespace (and so delete unknown
  devices, and set the default route).

Adapt for other Neutron changes since Liberty:

- neutron.agent.linux.dhcp's commonutils import changed to common_utils.
- DHCP agent code now requires NetModel.mtu to be a number (or else for
  'advertise_mtu' to be configured False).
- New mtu parameter in RoutedInterfaceDriver.plug_new.
- Adjust test code for different eventlet thread timing.

Change-Id: Ib580639dc341df8a931a947fb3d82f97d656a32b
Sem-Ver: feature
"}]
commit_message:
Support master Neutron code (Mitaka) as well as previous releases

This change adapts networking-calico's code so that it works with the
Neutron master code, as well as continuing to work with Liberty and
previous OpenStack releases.  As we're now very close to the Mitaka
release, working with master Neutron code should also mean working
with the Mitaka release.

Handle removal of deprecated use_namespaces option:

- Don't override use_namespaces, as it no longer exists to be
  overridden.
- Handle new Mitaka NetModel calls that don't allow a use_namespaces
  argument, and set _ns_name attribute to get equivalent effect.
- Use subclassing to override pieces of the DHCP agent implementation
  that assume they own their own namespace (and so delete unknown
  devices, and set the default route).

Adapt for other Neutron changes since Liberty:

- neutron.agent.linux.dhcp's commonutils import changed to common_utils.
- DHCP agent code now requires NetModel.mtu to be a number (or else for
  'advertise_mtu' to be configured False).
- New mtu parameter in RoutedInterfaceDriver.plug_new.
- Adjust test code for different eventlet thread timing.

Change-Id: Ib580639dc341df8a931a947fb3d82f97d656a32b
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove iptables checksum rule script

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148718/ has been merged so including
the post-up-checksum-rules script is no longer necessary. A new task has
been added so that the script will be removed during upgrades from Liberty.

Tests have been added to ensure that the dhcp agent is active, that the
dhcp network namespace is being created as expected, and that this
iptables rule is being created within that namespace.

The unconfined apparmor profile has also been applied to the neutron
test container so that it has the permissions required to create network
namespaces.

Change-Id: I068d091873d2744b0849b0d52a8083e129841b1b

commit_message:
Include security role in setup-hosts.yml

The openstack-ansible-security role is now included in the
setup-hosts.yml playbook but it still requires a deployer to
set apply_security_hardening to True for it to be applied.

Change-Id: I02324b15a4ddffa52b15a23bd381892d4dfd39fc

subject: Remove hard-coded pip indexes from repo-build playbook
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-31 19:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml'], 'message': 'Remove hard-coded pip indexes from repo-build playbook

With the repo build process pip indexes being optional, and the AIO
process making use of the OpenStack-CI provided pip.conf file, the
indexes no longer need to be set in the playbook.

This patch removes them, allowing the pip indexes to be entirely
controlled by the user.

Change-Id: I22c6fc38164b47b9ffa10de6de73a57c3e071c60
Depends-On: I25e4faecbffad6301509c62f55c34ba86b92a658
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hard-coded pip indexes from repo-build playbook

With the repo build process pip indexes being optional, and the AIO
process making use of the OpenStack-CI provided pip.conf file, the
indexes no longer need to be set in the playbook.

This patch removes them, allowing the pip indexes to be entirely
controlled by the user.

Change-Id: I22c6fc38164b47b9ffa10de6de73a57c3e071c60
Depends-On: I25e4faecbffad6301509c62f55c34ba86b92a658

commit_message:
Set lxc_container_caches not to use repo_pip_default_index

The LXC container cache may happen to use the same web server
as that set for the repo_pip_default_index but this is not an
assumption that should be made so readily.

This patch purposefully decouples these.

Change-Id: I9f8901d8c7f48a1de0511eb0ba1795a1db28405c

commit_message:
Drop the TestInit node_cache unit test

This test essentially tests get_session(), which is covered by anything else
touching the database code. More importantly, as it does not use any mocks,
it fails on stable/liberty right now.

Change-Id: I175a38bd3675aabe1c518a0b7d4c2bd56d93cc1a
(cherry picked from commit 0ec02d3695841f1557d2ba74c113499e2aa3b3bd)

commit_message:
Downgrade iptables duplicate rule bug

There is nothing the operators can do if there is a
duplicate rule bug that results in this message and
it won't impact operation so this should not be a
warning.

Change-Id: I864b5c069cfd25ba0641df59fd44964382146789

commit_message:
Allow redstack to force kvm in devstack

Force kvm is useful if you have an environment where you can use kvm as
the virtualization for nested instances.

Switch Freezer-api to oslo.config and oslo.log

Switching freezer-api to oslo config opts and oslo logging opts to
follow Openstack standards and benfit from oslo libraries

commit_message:
Fix configuring Cinder multibackend

Fix configuration of Cinder Multibackend: set every backend to
his own section.

Also this patches switches to use upstream cinder BDD manifests
and updates tests.

Change-Id: Ide8acc8232444b537e08e4f9bd775b423177c11f
Closes-bug: #1558607
Closes-bug: #1560499

commit_message:
Fix Cinder Block Device backend usage

This commit fixes typo in 'physical_volumes' variable, which is passing list of
devices for BDD backend.

Clean up openstack-cinder manifest from BDD backend, because it can't be installed
on controller node.

Also fix noop tests for role/cinder spec.

Change-Id: Ifc3213f2834151ff1a707073e9bb45289d5838d2
Related-bug: #1564445

commit_message:
Introduced command 'env redeploy' in v2 version of fuelclient

Example: `fuel2 env redeploy <env_id>`

Fixed deployment tests.
Fuel-web repo has been changed from 'stackforge' to 'openstack'.

Partial-Bug: 1540558
Change-Id: I6bc18ff672bc119c523841033fde4bbacb9290fd
Depends-On: Ibc89fdbfbd0a36a890412cd8e861d35bcf930690

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-03 07:21:19.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/pull.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/sshd_config.j2', 'etc/kolla/passwords.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/ssh_config.j2', 'docker/nova/nova-ssh/extend_start.sh', 'docker/nova/nova-ssh/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/id_rsa.pub', 'kolla/cmd/genpwd.py', 'requirements.txt', 'ansible/roles/nova/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/id_rsa', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/start_compute.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/do_reconfigure.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova-ssh.json.j2'], 'message': 'Implement nova-ssh container

Add a nova-ssh container to handle the `nova migrate` and

commit_message:
Implement nova-ssh container

Add a nova-ssh container to handle the `nova migrate` and
`nova resize` case, in which the nova will use ssh to copy
files between machines.

Change-Id: Ie6675943f3aeabfbba8589d308d55b9c89d732db
Closes-Bug: #1562141

commit_message:
Fix loading of angular in jquery modals

This patch fixes the invocation of the loadAngular method
which started failing (silently) when moved out of an
angular module context (variables it required were not
defined.

This patch also removes the try/catch that was silently
squashing errors, and adds documentation in the code
to explain what the loadAngular function's purpose
is.

Change-Id: I95382e89b5e8098af596319730328480c85e324d
Closes-Bug: 1494149
(cherry picked from commit 0f39dea2c7e722781fe3374abbaada781488c2cc)

commit_message:
Allow deleting gateway interfaces on network topology

We didn't allow to delete a router_gateway interface from a router
in the network topology due to the checking being done
working only on normal interfaces.

Change-Id: I35f7fc7c0050e1441a740a110fb6f45ddec9371d
Closes-Bug: 1548224
(cherry picked from commit 58b905bf1cdb36fce0b3f2133c773c7eff1b315d)

This fixes the OSC plugin so that if region is specified or if the

commit_message:
OSC plugin should be region/interface aware

This fixes the OSC plugin so that if region is specified or if the
interface is specified (public, internal, admin) then those will be
passed into the heat_client when instantiated.  Without this the
client will pick the endpoint for the first region returned instead of
the one specified.

Closes-Bug: #1556263
Change-Id: I9c15719e7711c93e7fd076d38d66011bb20f988d

subject: Use all valid MAC's for lookup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-18 12:41:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/process.py', 'ironic_inspector/plugins/standard.py', 'ironic_inspector/plugins/discovery.py', 'releasenotes/notes/lookup-all-macs-eead528c0b764ad7.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_plugins_discovery.py', 'ironic_inspector/utils.py', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_process.py'], 'message': 'Use all valid MAC's for lookup

Currently we are using only the resulting MAC(s) when doing a node lookup.
In many cases it is the MAC of the PXE-booting NIC. However, it's not necessary
the MAC that people used for enrolling the Ironic node, which will lead to
lookup failures on the virtual environment. This change makes the lookup
procedure use all of the valid MAC's.

Similarly, the enroll node_not_found_hook now checks all MAC's before creating
a node.

Code in the validate_interfaces hook was reordered to ensure we only keep
interfaces with valid MAC's even in the "all_interfaces" list.

Change-Id: Ie7df05d9a7855716fb835c90cfb0ac7fc4cd66df
'}]
commit_message:
Use all valid MAC's for lookup

Currently we are using only the resulting MAC(s) when doing a node lookup.
In many cases it is the MAC of the PXE-booting NIC. However, it's not necessary
the MAC that people used for enrolling the Ironic node, which will lead to
lookup failures on the virtual environment. This change makes the lookup
procedure use all of the valid MAC's.

Similarly, the enroll node_not_found_hook now checks all MAC's before creating
a node.

Code in the validate_interfaces hook was reordered to ensure we only keep
interfaces with valid MAC's even in the "all_interfaces" list.

Change-Id: Ie7df05d9a7855716fb835c90cfb0ac7fc4cd66df

commit_message:
Support using internal network for clients

Openstack mostly defaults to using public endpoints for
internal communication between services. This patch adds
a new option use-internal-endpoints which, if set to True,
will configure services to use internal endpoints where
possible.

Closes-Bug: 1456876
Change-Id: I736a0a281ec434067bc92fa70898b16a027f7422

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-01 12:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/ext/rest_parameters.py'], 'message': "Enhanced error handling for rest_parameters parser

Instead of throwing a KeyError if the lookup file isn't what we
expected, and dying, throw a warning and skip the key in content. This
makes it a bit easier to understand what's wrong and how to address it
for people not familiar with the code.

Change-Id: I0d1cb60b5a1010d00e5290f697bbde601fd5f221
"}]
commit_message:
Enhanced error handling for rest_parameters parser

Instead of throwing a KeyError if the lookup file isn't what we
expected, and dying, throw a warning and skip the key in content. This
makes it a bit easier to understand what's wrong and how to address it
for people not familiar with the code.

Change-Id: I0d1cb60b5a1010d00e5290f697bbde601fd5f221

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-23 11:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': "Fixed L3 agent manual scheduling for HA routers

When a router is manually scheduled we check if a router can be scheduled
to the given L3 agent. In this check we were missing handling for
HA router, instead we raised an exception as a last resort.

In addition, we create an HA port on the newly scheduled agent.
The HA port is created within the router's namespace on that agent.
Previously when manually scheduling this was not done at all.

This patch takes care of HA routers by allowing them to be
manually scheduled to a L3 agent if the router is not already
scheduled to that given L3 agent.

The patch also adds an HA port in the router's namespace on the newly
scheduled L3 agent.

In addition the patch also removes the 'max_l3_agents_per_router'
enforcement when manually schedulling a router on a agent. This is
done as the admin should be able to schedule a router on an agent
if he desires, moreover this is consistent with the
'min_l3_agents_per_router' that is not enforced when manually
descheduling a router from an agent.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py

Co-Authored-By: gong yong sheng <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Nir Magnezi <nmagnezi@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1401095

Change-Id: I1e2d281cfec50e7fff4ec68659882fc7c0cb4a29
(cherry picked from commit c6d0e45c9fb07fab4edf9be3a11ca00c8ffd0b84)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed L3 agent manual scheduling for HA routers

When a router is manually scheduled we check if a router can be scheduled
to the given L3 agent. In this check we were missing handling for
HA router, instead we raised an exception as a last resort.

In addition, we create an HA port on the newly scheduled agent.
The HA port is created within the router's namespace on that agent.
Previously when manually scheduling this was not done at all.

This patch takes care of HA routers by allowing them to be
manually scheduled to a L3 agent if the router is not already
scheduled to that given L3 agent.

The patch also adds an HA port in the router's namespace on the newly
scheduled L3 agent.

In addition the patch also removes the 'max_l3_agents_per_router'
enforcement when manually schedulling a router on a agent. This is
done as the admin should be able to schedule a router on an agent
if he desires, moreover this is consistent with the
'min_l3_agents_per_router' that is not enforced when manually
descheduling a router from an agent.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py
	neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py
	neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py

Co-Authored-By: gong yong sheng <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Nir Magnezi <nmagnezi@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1401095

Change-Id: I1e2d281cfec50e7fff4ec68659882fc7c0cb4a29
(cherry picked from commit c6d0e45c9fb07fab4edf9be3a11ca00c8ffd0b84)

subject: Update some tags for the Trove project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-22 15:07:24.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Update some tags for the Trove project

This is the second of multiple changes to fix tags on the trove
project.

In reviewing the tags for the Trove project, I find some tags and
assertions to be missing and I have added them. I have run the
validate-tags tool and it reported no errors relative to Trove. (to
save time, I ran the tool with a modified projects.yaml file that had
only Trove). I have retained the release:has-stable-branches on
trove-dashboard as that is the intent.

Change-Id: I8c55e7baaa4e2489d49d13705131a96bd33ef9d5
'}]
commit_message:
Update some tags for the Trove project

This is the second of multiple changes to fix tags on the trove
project.

In reviewing the tags for the Trove project, I find some tags and
assertions to be missing and I have added them. I have run the
validate-tags tool and it reported no errors relative to Trove. (to
save time, I ran the tool with a modified projects.yaml file that had
only Trove). I have retained the release:has-stable-branches on
trove-dashboard as that is the intent.

Change-Id: I8c55e7baaa4e2489d49d13705131a96bd33ef9d5

any password is empty in /etc/kolla/passwords.yml.

commit_message:
Add tests for compute v2.10 microversion

Nova microversion 2.10 adds the ability for admin
user to manage the keypair for other users.

As Tempest support microversion testing, this commit
adds the testing for compute v2.10 microversion.

Details of v2.10 microversion
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst

commit_message:
Increase ports per network and add SLA for rally

Increase the ports per network in the create and list ports
test. This also adds a max average time SLA so we can catch
regressions in performance.

Change-Id: I2e7e3fd7406db77c8e44dce2ab0b4594ff6f2db9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 10:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Scenarios manager: remove some dead code

`create_volume()` is always called with `wait_on_delete=True` so
this patch removes the code block when `wait_on_delete==False`.

This also has the benefit to remove one more hypothetical call to
`addCleanup_with_wait` which definition I can"t remotely understand.

Change-Id: I6a1db974816fe3508371512b7493170d0388f6cb
'}]
commit_message:
Scenarios manager: remove some dead code

`create_volume()` is always called with `wait_on_delete=True` so
this patch removes the code block when `wait_on_delete==False`.

This also has the benefit to remove one more hypothetical call to
`addCleanup_with_wait` which definition I can"t remotely understand.

Change-Id: I6a1db974816fe3508371512b7493170d0388f6cb
