subject: Don't use 1.3.0 version of cryptography
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 13:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Don't use 1.3.0 version of cryptography

This version can cause gate problems. As this version had an issue with
mocks [1].  This caused patches to have to work specifically for this
version such as [2].

1. https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2844
2. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295073/

Change-Id: I1129be0a0b03d8c640058247759f06fd97bb8c91
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use 1.3.0 version of cryptography

This version can cause gate problems. As this version had an issue with
mocks [1].  This caused patches to have to work specifically for this
version such as [2].

1. https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2844
2. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295073/

Change-Id: I1129be0a0b03d8c640058247759f06fd97bb8c91

1. Replace ipaddr by netaddr
2. Replace related iterators and log outputs by actual format
3. Replace deprecated assertEquals by assertEqual
   and disable ignore in flake8
4. Use @atomic instead of deprecated @commit_on_success

'}]
commit_message:
Replace ipaddr by netaddr

1. Replace ipaddr by netaddr
2. Replace related iterators and log outputs by actual format
3. Replace deprecated assertEquals by assertEqual
   and disable ignore in flake8
4. Use @atomic instead of deprecated @commit_on_success
   (unblock django version up)

blueprint fuel-qa-python3-compatibility

Change-Id: Ib79e2fbaa31796504c95f78bc7e4f4c83561ae3b

subject: Fixing filter on local nodes to check_resource function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:01:43.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Fixing filter on local nodes to check_resource function

We need to execute the egrep in a subshell making it alway return
true, otherwise it will break things while not finding anything
because of set -e.

Removed also sudo from nodes_local command.

Change-Id: I881b8e28be017834301d352cbfd6737567a3e385
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing filter on local nodes to check_resource function

We need to execute the egrep in a subshell making it alway return
true, otherwise it will break things while not finding anything
because of set -e.

Removed also sudo from nodes_local command.

Change-Id: I881b8e28be017834301d352cbfd6737567a3e385

subject: Remove oslo.context dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 11:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py', 'aodh/notifier/rest.py'], 'message': "Remove oslo.context dependency

oslo.context is only used to generate a request id, something we can
easily do since it's just about generating a random string.

There's no reason to depends on this library just for that, especially
since we're never going to use the rest of it.

Change-Id: I6b8618bdc32264f9f5e66a4697d1886e4f292dc8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo.context dependency

oslo.context is only used to generate a request id, something we can
easily do since it's just about generating a random string.

There's no reason to depends on this library just for that, especially
since we're never going to use the rest of it.

Change-Id: I6b8618bdc32264f9f5e66a4697d1886e4f292dc8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-01 09:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/centos/yum_repos.mk', 'sandbox.mk'], 'message': 'Disable yum verify SSL certificates/hosts at all

Disable SSL certificates check since we can have self signed
certs for yum repos

Change-Id: I38067ec3cf4e86b0b2623d716059763308ae0c5b
Closes-bug: #1541934
'}]
commit_message:
Disable yum verify SSL certificates/hosts at all

Disable SSL certificates check since we can have self signed
certs for yum repos

commit_message:
add bp:openstack-health spec

Specification to formalize the work in progress on the initial core
and four pages of OpenStack Health.
Adding an openstack-health folder as well to the specs folder, to
host future specs related to new views and extra functionality.

Change-Id: Ib90e4eae2e12e44e62220bac5cf86a5f69bfbf44
Partially-implements: bp openstack-health

commit_message:
Add extensions response table to Block Storage API v2

This patch adds extensions response table when users list API extensions
in Block Storage API v2
 + "updated": When the extension is updated

 + "alias": Remembered name of the extension

revisions:

  + cidr: The CIDR of the subnet

commit_message:
Add parameters to Network IP availability [Networking API v2 ext]

This patch adds more parameters to Network IP availability
[Networking APi v2 ext]:
  + cidr: The CIDR of the subnet
  + ip_version: Version of subnet, valid value is 4 or 6
  + name: Name of the subnet
  + total_ips: Number of IP addresses offered
  + used_ips: Number of IP address used

Change-Id: I8bc884553add7149765e1906dbb11a3d90a7d432
Closes-Bug: #1564689

commit_message:
Add tenant response tables to Identity API extensions v2.0 - OSKSADM

This patch ads tenant response tables when users create/update tenant
in Identity API extensions v2.0 - OSKSADM.
 + id: UUID of the tenant
 + name: Name of the tenant
 + description: Description of the tenant
 + enabled: Define whether the tenant is enabled or not
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v2-ext.html#createTenant

Change-Id: I4a386c8c6bc1b98289da15816e9ea56cd01ad96d
Closes-Bug: #1564692

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-17 04:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/compute_req_id.py'], 'message': 'Ensure consistency of ENV_REQUEST_ID

ENV_REQUEST_ID used in nova.api.auth.NovaKeystoneContext
is defined in oslo.middleware.
But ENV_REQUEST_ID in nova.api.compute_req_id.ComputeReqIdMiddleware
is defined in nova/api/compute_req_id.py.
Use ENV_REQUEST_ID of oslo.middleware in
nova.api.compute_req_id.ComputeReqIdMiddleware.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ife6bb1898246db724e912e0183858a372ace1924
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure consistency of ENV_REQUEST_ID

ENV_REQUEST_ID used in nova.api.auth.NovaKeystoneContext
is defined in oslo.middleware.
But ENV_REQUEST_ID in nova.api.compute_req_id.ComputeReqIdMiddleware
is defined in nova/api/compute_req_id.py.
Use ENV_REQUEST_ID of oslo.middleware in
nova.api.compute_req_id.ComputeReqIdMiddleware.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ife6bb1898246db724e912e0183858a372ace1924

commit_message:
Remove unused magnum-ui mitaka translation job

the whole time on master. With the end of the mitaka translation

subject: Accommodate v2 and v3 auth for integration tests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-30 05:32:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_aws_stack.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_preview.py', 'heat_integrationtests/common/config.py', 'heat_integrationtests/heat_integrationtests.conf.sample', 'heat_integrationtests/common/clients.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_conditional_exposure.py'], 'message': 'Accommodate v2 and v3 auth for integration tests

This patch has two reviews:

1.  devstack has moved default Keystone API version to v3[1].
[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/f4ce44bf3fbf06e53c2ae3ec6aa4996831cf4605
Though the above patch has been reverted, this would help
if devstack removes v2 support in the future.

2. use domain env variables as defaults.
Use OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME and OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME
env variables as the defaults for keystone v3 in
integration tests.

Squash of commit e80d27213cf4489aeeda48e2bdb5a890d8b56433
and commit 55713b94bf31409b4b0f8d3ba9ea9bc3b598f34a

Closes-Bug: #1539692

Change-Id: I393750d00b3712a015e48a3cf38ab5f95bb61dae
'}]
commit_message:
Accommodate v2 and v3 auth for integration tests

This patch has two reviews:

1.  devstack has moved default Keystone API version to v3[1].
[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/f4ce44bf3fbf06e53c2ae3ec6aa4996831cf4605
Though the above patch has been reverted, this would help
if devstack removes v2 support in the future.

2. use domain env variables as defaults.
Use OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME and OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME
env variables as the defaults for keystone v3 in
integration tests.

Squash of commit e80d27213cf4489aeeda48e2bdb5a890d8b56433
and commit 55713b94bf31409b4b0f8d3ba9ea9bc3b598f34a

Closes-Bug: #1539692
Closes-Bug: #1560032

Change-Id: I393750d00b3712a015e48a3cf38ab5f95bb61dae

commit_message:
Heat integration tests failing against https endpoints

Provide ca_file option to pass the ca certificate to verify https
connection. Also pass verify parameter to the test cases which
directly call requests library methods.

Change-Id: I4a81047136d6a64b151180e95c254edea8165349
Closes-Bug: #1553898
(cherry picked from commit 1b23afe9716b9bb64969ed5d68ccf62ebeaf15bf)

commit_message:
Make cache interface the same as oslo_cache

For ease in transition to oslo_cache make the existing cache have the
same interface as the oslo_cache objects. This way we can use the
different cache objects interchangably.

Related-Bug: #1523375
Change-Id: Ia2ced021cb68b658c9a70dbcb1842810c033c6f5

commit_message:
Revert "Remove senlin CLI commands"

This reverts commit 3bda3b997bf3701746c7a2e4760f9528a18a2cbd.

We cannot rely on openstackclient as it is today. There are OSC
parameters preventing senlin client from normal operation and we see no
easy resolution when both OSC and senlinclient has been released.

Change-Id: I6b09699afcd45d36caea3e9f6ee0d132cc57354f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-30 20:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

The releasenotes job has no constraints file, so override the install
command there.

This commit is being proposed on stable/liberty and therefore the
install command includes the clear designation of the branch. This is
because, on branches other than master, we need to be sure to get the
upper-constraints.txt file for that branch.

Change-Id: I9c37be55769d5a4a9ed1704f36302596a5f9ee2d
Closes-Bug: #1563038
(cherry picked from commit aca90168f52169afb36500d6af77723b1a707008)
"}]
commit_message:
Trove's tox tests should respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

The releasenotes job has no constraints file, so override the install
command there.

This commit is being proposed on stable/liberty and therefore the
install command includes the clear designation of the branch. This is
because, on branches other than master, we need to be sure to get the
upper-constraints.txt file for that branch.

Change-Id: I9c37be55769d5a4a9ed1704f36302596a5f9ee2d
Closes-Bug: #1563038
(cherry picked from commit aca90168f52169afb36500d6af77723b1a707008)

Fix releasenotes translation rule

releasenotes are in the top-level directory, so no need to add
ZanataDocFolder (which is doc for most projects) here. Remove
it so that translation import works.

commit_message:
Generate fedora-atomic images using dib

It consumes an external deployed tree, and generates a
cloud bootable image based on that. It relies on lvm element
to generate the volumes needed for the image.

Change-Id: I0ea8aa4e5a762c23b1476dc40fe05818a09ed132

subject: Restart haproxy after configuring SSL certs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20990, 'name': 'Zhili Liu', 'email': 'zhili.liu@ericsson.com', 'username': 'zhilil'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:42:08.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_maintenance_mode.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/pre_puppet_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "Restart haproxy after configuring SSL certs

If a certificate expires, the user will need to update it.  However,
because we only restart services at the end of a stack-update the
new certificate doesn't take effect until after puppet has run.
This is a problem because puppet makes OpenStack calls, which will
fail if the certificate is expired.  In that case we never get to
the service restart so the stack is wedged until the user manually
restart haproxy.

This patch addresses the problem by reloading haproxy before puppet
runs.  This is done in a pre-puppet script for pacemaker after pacemaker
is maintenance mode because we need to make sure it happens after all of
the certs have been installed on the controllers, but before puppet
runs.

For non-pacemaker, haproxy is simply reloaded.

Change-Id: Id5ed05b3a20d06af8ae7a3d6f859b03399b0d77d
"}]
commit_message:
Restart haproxy after configuring SSL certs

If a certificate expires, the user will need to update it.  However,
because we only restart services at the end of a stack-update the
new certificate doesn't take effect until after puppet has run.
This is a problem because puppet makes OpenStack calls, which will
fail if the certificate is expired.  In that case we never get to
the service restart so the stack is wedged until the user manually
restart haproxy.

This patch addresses the problem by reloading haproxy before puppet
runs.  This is done in a pre-puppet script for pacemaker after pacemaker
is maintenance mode because we need to make sure it happens after all of
the certs have been installed on the controllers, but before puppet
runs.

For non-pacemaker, haproxy is simply reloaded.

Change-Id: Id5ed05b3a20d06af8ae7a3d6f859b03399b0d77d

commit_message:
Increase heat rpc_response_timeout in the overcloud

Due to the high load being observed in the CI environment, we should
increase the heat rpc_response_timeout configuration to 600s instead of
the default value of 60s to see if this helps with the 504 Gateway
Errors during the pingtest.

Change-Id: I1474e8df55e06f4c7e3c9de509f5e38ca727d761
Partial-Bug: #1537898

subject: Don't configure Nova v3 service
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-03 14:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/constants.py'], 'message': "Don't configure Nova v3 service

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work.

The /v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint.

What we called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in particular with the backwards-compat thing I mentioned earlier.

We keep the /v2 path in api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1 codepath (just not asking for microversions)

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/etc/nova/api-paste.ini#L18

In summary, we only need one endpoint, ie. /v2.1

Depends-On: I1474e8df55e06f4c7e3c9de509f5e38ca727d761
Change-Id: Icdda1e08dd691aeca693725931709dcdc0efaf57
Related-Bug: #1564372
(cherry picked from commit 352a9f1567937e2fce08c65ffd29c399441238fc)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't configure Nova v3 service

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work.

The /v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint.

What we called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in particular with the backwards-compat thing I mentioned earlier.

We keep the /v2 path in api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1 codepath (just not asking for microversions)

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/etc/nova/api-paste.ini#L18

In summary, we only need one endpoint, ie. /v2.1

Depends-On: I1474e8df55e06f4c7e3c9de509f5e38ca727d761
Change-Id: Icdda1e08dd691aeca693725931709dcdc0efaf57
Related-Bug: #1564372
(cherry picked from commit 352a9f1567937e2fce08c65ffd29c399441238fc)

commit_message:
[new project] Create a OpenStack related project "daisycloud-core"

daisycloud is an installer which provides automated deployment and
management of OpenStack and other distributed systems.

daisycloud is an open source project (https://github.com/opendaisy)
and has been used widely by our customers already. To attract more
developers to join us, we would like to take the advantages of using
the OpenStack tool-chain and development infrastructure.

daisycloud-core is the core module project of daisycloud.

Change-Id: I10af17adb8510848ef6148527cc3cd7713104087
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhijiang@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Configure ControllerServices via resource chains

This patch wires in a new for Mitaka Heat feature
that allows us to dynamically include a set of nested
stacks representing individual services via a Heat resource chain.
Follow on patches will use this interface to decompose the controller
role into isolated services.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Depends-On: If510abe260ea7852dfe2d1f7f92b529979483068
Change-Id: I84c97a76159704c2d6c963bc4b26e365764b1366

[{'number': 31, 'created': '2016-04-01 09:07:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'neutron: Update the port with a MAC address for PFs

In case of an SR-IOV PF as a neutron port, we should really update
Neutron with the proper MAC, as it is known only once the instance has
claimed a device on the compute host.

This patch adds a local Neutron API method that will grab the MAC
address based on the claimed device, and pass it on with the binding
port updates that happen during network allocation.

Change-Id: I7eafcaa9147bb9cbe7c7c8cda34ec259be0b0eb5
Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: Update the port with a MAC address for PFs

In case of an SR-IOV PF as a neutron port, we should really update
Neutron with the proper MAC, as it is known only once the instance has
claimed a device on the compute host.

This patch adds a local Neutron API method that will grab the MAC
address based on the claimed device, and pass it on with the binding
port updates that happen during network allocation.

Change-Id: I7eafcaa9147bb9cbe7c7c8cda34ec259be0b0eb5
Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port

subject: Neutron test cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-03 12:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prepare-host.yml', 'tests/inventory', 'tests/test-install-keystone.yml', 'tests/test-install-neutron.yml', 'tests/group_vars/all_containers.yml', 'tests/test-prepare-keys.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Neutron test cleanup

This commit does the following:

- fully defines the inventory rather than having test-prepare-host.yml
  add containers to it
- updates test-prepare-keys.yml to use localhost instead of 127.0.0.1,
  uses become_user=jenkins instead of become=false, and removes
  redundant connection
- updates test-prepare-host.yml by changing 127.0.0.1 to localhost, and
  removes mocking ansible_env
- groups vars in defined in each individual file into a single
  test-vars.yml file
- installs libffi-dev in test-install-neutron.yml, which is necessary
  to build neutron (installed by default in gate, so not an issue
  there)
- switches neutron_provider_networks to vxlan, otherwise
  neutron-linuxbridge-agent doesn't actually work correctly

Change-Id: Ice7e4762fb184d9172c6b8192f4e6d1732654bb9
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron test cleanup

This commit does the following:

- fully defines the inventory rather than having test-prepare-host.yml
  add containers to it
- updates test-prepare-keys.yml to use localhost instead of 127.0.0.1,
  uses become_user=jenkins instead of become=false, and removes
  redundant connection
- updates test-prepare-host.yml by changing 127.0.0.1 to localhost, and
  removes mocking ansible_env
- groups vars in defined in each individual file into a single
  test-vars.yml file
- installs libffi-dev in test-install-neutron.yml, which is necessary
  to build neutron (installed by default in gate, so not an issue
  there)
- switches neutron_provider_networks to vxlan, otherwise
  neutron-linuxbridge-agent doesn't actually work correctly

Change-Id: Ice7e4762fb184d9172c6b8192f4e6d1732654bb9

commit_message:
add arp_responder flag to linuxbridge agent

When the ARP responder is enabled, secondary IP addresses explicitly
allowed by via the allowed-address-pairs extensions do not resolve.
This change adds the ability to enable the local ARP responder similar
to the feature in the OVS agent.  This change disables local ARP
responses by default, so ARP traffic will be sent over the overlay.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I5da4afa44fc94032880ea59ec574df504470fb4a
Closes-Bug: 1445089
(cherry picked from commit bbd881f3a970143e1954cb277e5235dddd26c5d0)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-01 02:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1559026-47c3fa3468d66b07.yaml', 'nova/cmd/novnc.py', 'nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_baseproxy.py'], 'message': "The 'record' option of the WebSocketProxy should be string

If proxy service (VNC, spice, serial) is started with the 'record'
option, an exception is thrown. This is because WebSocketProxy
expects a file path for the record argument instead of boolean
value. This patch fixes this by changing 'record' to be string
option. An empty string means no recording.

Closes-Bug: #1559026

Change-Id: Id6cf7c65191bdaa579f7cdadea43230897436de6
"}]
commit_message:
The 'record' option of the WebSocketProxy should be string

If proxy service (VNC, spice, serial) is started with the 'record'
option, an exception is thrown. This is because WebSocketProxy
expects a file path for the record argument instead of boolean
value. This patch fixes this by changing 'record' to be string
option. An empty string means no recording.

Closes-Bug: #1559026

Change-Id: Id6cf7c65191bdaa579f7cdadea43230897436de6

commit_message:
remove the ability to disable v2.1

The option to enable (and thus possibly disable) v2.1 was deprecated
in Mitaka. It should now be removed. v2.1 is a required part of the
API and it was default on.

Change-Id: Ia446040e3b4e87438712e7d8c1bafda0a6e53999

Add note about big files download

Murano doesn't support big files download during actions execution. This
problem wasn't covered in documentation previously.

subject: Track status report timestamp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 11:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/status_reporter.py', 'murano/common/server.py'], 'message': 'Track status report timestamp

Report status messages were ordered by the time
they were inserted into database. And that is the
time they were received and processed not the
time the report message was generated. So if
deployment generates reports faster than they
get processed it can be that they accumulate
in RabbitMQ and then received by the API not
in original order. Another possibility is that
several API instances would get those messages
and because of the race condition insert them
into database in wrong order.

With this fix report timestamp becomes part
of the report itself and is inserted into "created"
table column. Thus created is now when the
report was created, not the database record.

Change-Id: I1d41d644ed399cb9d58192e567f11187fa2cf593
Closes-Bug: #1462270
'}]
commit_message:
Track status report timestamp

Report status messages were ordered by the time
they were inserted into database. And that is the
time they were received and processed not the
time the report message was generated. So if
deployment generates reports faster than they
get processed it can be that they accumulate
in RabbitMQ and then received by the API not
in original order. Another possibility is that
several API instances would get those messages
and because of the race condition insert them
into database in wrong order.

With this fix report timestamp becomes part
of the report itself and is inserted into "created"
table column. Thus created is now when the
report was created, not the database record.

Change-Id: I1d41d644ed399cb9d58192e567f11187fa2cf593
Closes-Bug: #1462270

commit_message:
Track status report timestamp

Report status messages were ordered by the time
they were inserted into database. And that is the
time they were received and processed not the
time the report message was generated. So if
deployment generates reports faster than they
get processed it can be that they accumulate
in RabbitMQ and then received by the API not
in original order. Another possibility is that
several API instances would get those messages
and because of the race condition insert them
into database in wrong order.

With this fix report timestamp becomes part
of the report itself and is inserted into "created"
table column. Thus created is now when the
report was created, not the database record.

Change-Id: I5b705ee95c6fa2275937513aba0bcb0053c0901c
Closes-Bug: #1462270

commit_message:
Track status report timestamp

Report status messages were ordered by the time
they were inserted into database. And that is the
time they were received and processed not the
time the report message was generated. So if
deployment generates reports faster than they
get processed it can be that they accumulate
in RabbitMQ and then received by the API not
in original order. Another possibility is that
several API instances would get those messages
and because of the race condition insert them
into database in wrong order.

With this fix report timestamp becomes part
of the report itself and is inserted into "created"
table column. Thus created is now when the
report was created, not the database record.

Change-Id: I1d41d644ed399cb9d58192e567f11187fa2cf593
Closes-Bug: #1462270

commit_message:
pci: Add utility method for getting the MAC addr

We will need to tell Neutron about the MAC address of the PF port as it
cannot set by the VIF driver.

This method lets su figure it out from sysfs

Change-Id: Iad44405488395ce08d1a893f50edfce20fdae7d2
Related-blueprint: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port

commit_message:
DNM: Debugging change.

The stable/liberty branch is failing with:

 Collecting httpretty<0.8.7,>=0.8.4 (from -r /opt/stack/new/requirements/global-requirements.txt (line 267))
   Downloading http://mirror.gra1.ovh.openstack.org/pypi/packages/source/h/httpretty/httpretty-0.8.6.tar.gz (40kB)
     Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
     Traceback (most recent call last):
       File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
       File "/tmp/pip-build-tkc16u5k/httpretty/setup.py", line 86, in <module>
         version=read_version(),
       File "/tmp/pip-build-tkc16u5k/httpretty/setup.py", line 46, in read_version
         finder.visit(ast.parse(local_file('httpretty', '__init__.py')))
       File "/tmp/pip-build-tkc16u5k/httpretty/setup.py", line 78, in <lambda>
         open(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), *f)).read()
       File "/tmp/tmp2n5Yww/lib/python3.4/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode
         return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
     UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 133: ordinal not in range(128)

I can't reproduce it outside the gate so this change is to reproduce it and
then try to debug it.

Related-Bug: 1560808
Depends-On: If9e8dfadb2ff160bb7c2b2993fab498a96a6906c
Change-Id: I1cea9763c0f547b5f2212b4943044136d11f8972

commit_message:
Fix N231 error about '_' using with _i18n lib

The neutron changeset of 44be13a2a689564b554a8371235e6bf8e3140a5c
introduce new hacking rule of N340 and N341. This patch resolves errors
by them.
i18n lib need the _i18n of app imported in one level. So this patch move
the file into networking-odl directory.

Change-Id: If2d35014880f2f5cd8fa32cb2cc6469b83b2814b
Closes-Bug: #1564737
Co-Authored-By: Yalei Wang <yalei.wang@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

commit_message:
remove glance deprecated config

This removes the very old glance config options which were deprecated
in I9054bcfb7f5a4a31f0bbfd770c00c767f3d165ba in favor of
glance.api_servers config option. This is required to clear out any
default glance servers so that we could pull from the service catalog
as a default in the future.

Change-Id: Ie2d767c4422ef339d6dcb826f3c8ba3c7cf79f85

commit_message:
Switch to Atomic 23

Change the devstack image to the default Atomic 23 image.
Update templates not to rely on interface naming because the names
changed between Atomic 21 and Atomic 23 images.
Add a functional test to validate minion node registration.
Update docs to refer to a generic Atomic image.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin.lu@huawei.com>

Implements: blueprint atomic23
Change-Id: Id67244e3f452b3c7c3c46fdabcca3a5c141a76c0

commit_message:
package: fix wrong catch in email parsing

email.MessageError exception does not exist, so if an error occur, the
code block will fail completely. Fix the path to the correct class.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic4e69405ca6346191da66a86f0b7aa5b3b75bed6

commit_message:
Remove minion dependency on master

Make thhe minions work correctly without depending on the master.
Removing this dependency decreases provisioning time by provisioning
nodes in parallel.

Change-Id: I025dbf54ef0cdafc4fe26acc33a9faed8cacd1ca
Partial-Bug: 1536739
Partial-Bug: 1551824

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-31 17:45:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_rt_servers.py'], 'message': "Set 'libvirt.sysinfo_serial' to 'none' in RealTimeServersTest

During execution of nova test case 'nova.tests.functional.libvirt.
test_rt_servers.RealTimeServersTest.test_success', 'LibvirtDriver.
_sysinfo_serial_func' method will be called to get information from
the compute host[1] if value of 'CONF.libvirt.sysinfo_serial' is
not 'none', this is not expected during test run.

We should set 'CONF.libvirt.sysinfo_serial' to 'none' in test case
so that it would not try to get info from compute host during execution.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L569-L577

Change-Id: I0f6c7fcea34c3ecaa9b19861a7640fda551f040f
Closes-bug: #1559579
"}]
commit_message:
Set 'libvirt.sysinfo_serial' to 'none' in RealTimeServersTest

During execution of nova test case 'nova.tests.functional.libvirt.
test_rt_servers.RealTimeServersTest.test_success', 'LibvirtDriver.
_sysinfo_serial_func' method will be called to get information from
the compute host[1] if value of 'CONF.libvirt.sysinfo_serial' is
not 'none', this is not expected during test run.

We should set 'CONF.libvirt.sysinfo_serial' to 'none' in test case
so that it would not try to get info from compute host during execution.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L569-L577

Change-Id: I0f6c7fcea34c3ecaa9b19861a7640fda551f040f
Closes-bug: #1559579

commit_message:
fix reno in stable/mitaka

Update the mitaka page and the current series page so that reno notes
backported into the stable branch are tested before landing to ensure we
don't break the release note build in master.

subject: set up the unreleased page for reno
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-02 18:55:14.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'set up the unreleased page for reno

We always need a page pulling from the "current" branch to detect errors
in markup in release notes files. We're going to change the mitaka page
to refer to that branch, so add a separate page that never needs to be
changed for "current".

Change-Id: Iaaec657e890883f5e4c0ab9873721ec3ac32ee7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
set up the unreleased page for reno

We always need a page pulling from the "current" branch to detect errors
in markup in release notes files. We're going to change the mitaka page
to refer to that branch, so add a separate page that never needs to be
changed for "current".

Change-Id: Iaaec657e890883f5e4c0ab9873721ec3ac32ee7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix config value type

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 01:58:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Fix config value type

This commit fixes config value types. 'pool_size' and 'pool_recycle'
should be int not string.

Change-Id: Ibeb954a43d8e1731e6e827a25afc404e6aecdae5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix config value type

This commit fixes config value types. 'pool_size' and 'pool_recycle'
should be int not string.

We are seeing tenant stack delete failures in the Overcloud
which seem to be due to Heat API RPC failures. This patch
bumps the default RPC timeout for heat to 10 minutes
which should match that of the undercloud. (The
previous heat default was 1 minute.)

Related-bug: #1565253
'}]
commit_message:
Bump overcloud heat rpc response timeout

We are seeing tenant stack delete failures in the Overcloud
which seem to be due to Heat API RPC failures. This patch
bumps the default RPC timeout for heat to 10 minutes
which should match that of the undercloud. (The
previous heat default was 1 minute.)

Change-Id: I099d75ee9b1fddc996671d52c1c74797b5d8768a
Related-bug: #1565253

subject: Change openstack/kolla repo release type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 15:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Change openstack/kolla repo release type

The openstack/kolla repository has followed the
release:cycle_with_milestones schedule +/- 1-3 days for all
milestones except where the PTL was ill with a root canal that
failed causing Mitaka-1 to be tagged far later then it should have
been. In that case, the PTL added backup release managers
(Sam Yaple and Angus Salkeld) so that wouldn't occur in the future.

Still we are faced with a problem.  Some things we depend on, like
the RDO upstream release of a release for our binary packaging
for CenTOS or the Ubuntu cloud-archive release of our binary packaging
for Ubuntu lag the official release deadlines by a week or more.

Further, some projects we depend on are either late, or make last
minute changes which break Kolla or introduce deprecations during
RC's which we fix in that release.

Hence this tag change depends on an extension to the
release:cycle_with_milestones deadline to deal with the special
cases deployment projects have to deal with.

Our alternative here is to tag a z.0.0 release on the posted schedules
that may be DOA in some ways (especially around binary packaging) and
shortly after those problems are sorted out, release a z.0.1 release.

Change-Id: I1cb753250b1ac0d61d01e2e828ffc6f9eeacf862
"}]
commit_message:
Change openstack/kolla repo release type

The openstack/kolla repository has followed the
release:cycle_with_milestones schedule +/- 1-3 days for all
milestones except where the PTL was ill with a root canal that
failed causing Mitaka-1 to be tagged far later then it should have
been. In that case, the PTL added backup release managers
(Sam Yaple and Angus Salkeld) so that wouldn't occur in the future.

Still we are faced with a problem.  Some things we depend on, like
the RDO upstream release of a release for our binary packaging
for CenTOS or the Ubuntu cloud-archive release of our binary packaging
for Ubuntu lag the official release deadlines by a week or more.

Further, some projects we depend on are either late, or make last
minute changes which break Kolla or introduce deprecations during
RC's which we fix in that release.

Hence this tag change depends on an extension to the
release:cycle_with_milestones deadline to deal with the special
cases deployment projects have to deal with.

Our alternative here is to tag a z.0.0 release on the posted schedules
that may be DOA in some ways (especially around binary packaging) and
shortly after those problems are sorted out, release a z.0.1 release.

Change-Id: I1cb753250b1ac0d61d01e2e828ffc6f9eeacf862

commit_message:
Add support for Tempest plugin packages

This patch allows to install Tempest plugin packages provided by RDO.
Disabled by default, manage_tests_packages boolean if set to True will
install Python packages that are needed when a service is set as
available in ::tempest class.

Change-Id: Iac9a57c2ba006bb2a660d2b54ee05bbe68125abf

commit_message:
Bump oslo.context >= 2.2.0 to store roles

Currently many projects(Glance, Nova, Heat and many others) use
custom 'roles' attribute in RequestContext to store info about
user roles. Starting from 2.2.0 release oslo.context provides
'roles' attribute so all projects can start to use it instead
of custom attributes.

Change-Id: I211b5548393f79856b1e894f3e5a8603b5df04ab

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 01:49:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/monitor_metric.py'], 'message': 'Convert MonitorMetric to use FloatField for values

The MonitorMetric returns decimal numbers between [0, 1] however
the value field is an IntegerField which means that values are
cast to zero most of the time as they are usually 0.X value.

This patch converts it to a FloatField so that it returns a proper
float value.

Closes-Bug: #1564182

Change-Id: I9d57e4ed0def084ac6e6fb9752106d79c374ce0d
'}]
commit_message:
Convert MonitorMetric to use FloatField for values

The MonitorMetric returns decimal numbers between [0, 1] however
the value field is an IntegerField which means that values are
cast to zero most of the time as they are usually 0.X value.

This patch converts it to a FloatField so that it returns a proper
float value.

Closes-Bug: #1564182

Change-Id: I9d57e4ed0def084ac6e6fb9752106d79c374ce0d

subject: Add image size report
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 02:58:52.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': 'Add image size report

In the common case of not specifying a size, we are already running
"du" over the image to figure out how big it is.  Leverage that by
saving it's output and displaying a pruned list of big files when
requested.

We add a flag to show a summarised option (files >10MiB) and another
to show full output, should you wish that level of detail.

"Invocation" documentation is updated (and formatted a little better
while we're here).

Change-Id: I255800790a62fed1c82fcd311f1cc29c9867766d
'}]
commit_message:
Add image size report

In the common case of not specifying a size, we are already running
"du" over the image to figure out how big it is.  Leverage that by
saving it's output and displaying a pruned list of big files when
requested.

We add a flag to show a summarised option (files >10MiB) and another
to show full output, should you wish that level of detail.

"Invocation" documentation is updated (and formatted a little better
while we're here).

Change-Id: I255800790a62fed1c82fcd311f1cc29c9867766d

commit_message:
Don't mask authorization errors

Project show with name argument returns 'Could not find resource'
error when the user is not authorized. It should report the
authorization error instead. This patch makes that change.

Change-Id: Iac3521f8a411060b0ec9ef46c8f0e1f3551e56ae
Closes-Bug: #1511625

commit_message:
Bump oslo.context to 2.2.0

This version introduces the following functionality that can now be
incorporated in projects subclassing oslo.context

* 2.2.0 add roles attribute to RequestContext
* 2.1.0 introduces an agnostic from_dict that can be removed from
  subclassed classes
* 2.0.0 introduces get_logging_values method to be used by oslo.log

Change-Id: Id2f952989da011a79ce2a44910e7bb291e1d0944

subject: When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 21:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/keepalived.conf.j2'], 'message': 'When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together

When a node uses two physical interfaces for its two VIPs, these
physical interfaces should be tied together, so both VIPs will
be taken out of scheduling if either one fails.  Without this change,
if a request comes into one interface that needs access to the
second interface to process the request, the original request
unnecessarily fails.  Repeating this results in a black hole where
a failing server keeps getting new requests.

Change-Id: Ic51e6584c1fbda3eb7821cb47f759c77e562cc65
Closes-Bug: #1550455
(cherry picked from commit bbbe84667d49cebaa8b40366f9e3be79a47e2606)
'}]
commit_message:
When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together

When a node uses two physical interfaces for its two VIPs, these
physical interfaces should be tied together, so both VIPs will
be taken out of scheduling if either one fails.  Without this change,
if a request comes into one interface that needs access to the
second interface to process the request, the original request
unnecessarily fails.  Repeating this results in a black hole where
a failing server keeps getting new requests.

Change-Id: Ic51e6584c1fbda3eb7821cb47f759c77e562cc65
Closes-Bug: #1550455
(cherry picked from commit bbbe84667d49cebaa8b40366f9e3be79a47e2606)

subject: Workaround ansible bug related to delegate_to
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 21:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml'], 'message': 'Workaround ansible bug related to delegate_to

Currently the delegate_to doesnt happen and the neutron role creation is
attempted once on the first server and is skipped. The re-ordering of hosts in
site.yml seems to make the first host to be one inside neutron-server group
yielding the expected results. This patch needs to be re-visited as soon as a
version of ansible is chosen that fixes the issues with delegate_to

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Potter <nathaniel.potter@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ganesh Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ia712b323aa9d750d470a11ee899ab1b3054a903f
Partial-Bug: #1546789
(cherry picked from commit 0bba5fe0007b281c0a2ee75e4f1c9f3950413e6f)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround ansible bug related to delegate_to

Currently the delegate_to doesnt happen and the neutron role creation is
attempted once on the first server and is skipped. The re-ordering of hosts in
site.yml seems to make the first host to be one inside neutron-server group
yielding the expected results. This patch needs to be re-visited as soon as a
version of ansible is chosen that fixes the issues with delegate_to

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Potter <nathaniel.potter@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ganesh Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ia712b323aa9d750d470a11ee899ab1b3054a903f
Partial-Bug: #1546789
(cherry picked from commit 0bba5fe0007b281c0a2ee75e4f1c9f3950413e6f)

commit_message:
Remove passwordResponseParameter from Identity V3 API

Retrieved user details do not include the user password, therefore removing this
entry. The password is filtered out [1] and not returned when accessing the API
using admin credentials.

There was also a passwordResponseParameter entity defined but not used in the
database section, removed that entry as well.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/identity/core.py#n59


Closes-Bug: 1564768
Change-Id: I82f2a55bf67a0a5a0fb1d1499ca48a507252dd2a

commit_message:

Currently, the values of "xsd:boolean" is some times presented by True or true. As my knowledge, the value should be true. Reference link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1308491/xsdboolean-element-typed -accept-true-but-not-true-how-can-i-make-it-accept Change-Id: I774dc5c5d805a9d11b0fefc7859c354d88b57ec5 Partial-Bug: #1562766 '}]
commit_message: Unify value of "xsd:boolean" in Networking API v2.0 This patch makes values of "xsd:boolean" in Networking API v2.0 to be uniform. Currently, the values of "xsd:boolean" is some times presented by True or true. As my knowledge, the value should be true. Reference link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1308491/xsdboolean-element-typed -accept-true-but-not-true-how-can-i-make-it-accept Change-Id: I774dc5c5d805a9d11b0fefc7859c354d88b57ec5 Partial-Bug: #1562766

In LBaaS v1.0 pools related sections, all response parameter

commit_message:
Adds response parameter and revises JSON request and responses

In LBaaS v1.0 pools related sections, all response parameter
tables miss one response parameter - status_description. Besides,
JSON request response of "creat a load balancer pool" and most of
the JSON responses are not correct. This patch adds the most
up-to-date example JSON formats.

Change-Id: I8f8dd5c40460d5805ceb5d4e6acecb43c480278a
Closes-Bug: #1563671

subject: Fixes wrong response parameter in health monitor section
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 05:23:18.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/networking-api/src/common.ent'], 'message': 'Fixes wrong response parameter in health monitor section

In networking API v2.0 extensions, LBaaS v1.0 section, all the
four response parameter tables related to health monitor - list,
create, show and update, include non-existing response parameter
- "status". While the existing response parameter - "pools" is
not listed.

Change-Id: I5c8646a7c3796814c634e268d58c35fd8a086be1
Closes-Bug: #1564225
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes wrong response parameter in health monitor section

In networking API v2.0 extensions, LBaaS v1.0 section, all the
four response parameter tables related to health monitor - list,
create, show and update, include non-existing response parameter
- "status". While the existing response parameter - "pools" is
not listed.

Change-Id: I5c8646a7c3796814c634e268d58c35fd8a086be1
Closes-Bug: #1564225

The request parameter shown in JSON request format is not listed
in request parameters table and is not a legal attribute when
creating a load balancer health monitor, thus should be deleted.

The corresponding JSON response format is also fixed.

Change-Id: Ide050fbbce898cdd58785840f65c75bbb42db5a2
Closes-Bug: #1564227
'}]
commit_message:
Delete "pool_id" in JSON request format in Create a health monitor

The request parameter shown in JSON request format is not listed
in request parameters table and is not a legal attribute when
creating a load balancer health monitor, thus should be deleted.

The corresponding JSON response format is also fixed.

Change-Id: Ide050fbbce898cdd58785840f65c75bbb42db5a2
Closes-Bug: #1564227

subject: copy_puppet_logs: gzip only files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-02 00:40:44.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/copy_puppet_logs.sh'], 'message': 'copy_puppet_logs: gzip only files

At the end of jenkins/scripts/copy_puppet_logs.sh script,
make sure we only try to compress files and not directories.

It will avoid this kind of error:
gzip: ./ssl.txt is a directory -- ignored

Change-Id: Iab6273b16e503d1b5f81267a14f0a3d144f730a3
'}]
commit_message:
copy_puppet_logs: gzip only files

At the end of jenkins/scripts/copy_puppet_logs.sh script,
make sure we only try to compress files and not directories.

It will avoid this kind of error:
gzip: ./ssl.txt is a directory -- ignored

Change-Id: Iab6273b16e503d1b5f81267a14f0a3d144f730a3

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-31 09:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Allow to update resource per single node.

At the moment during Ironic instance termination resources are updated
for all nodes. As result with high numner of nodes, removing N instances
initiates N x M requests, where M is the total number of nodes.
This commit allows to update resources per specific node only.

Co-Authored-By: Yuriy Zveryanskyy (yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com)
Related-Bug: #1552446
Change-Id: Iffad4a6ab1aaa5fea591c19f6d330dc861c5675d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to update resource per single node.

At the moment during Ironic instance termination resources are updated
for all nodes. As result with high numner of nodes, removing N instances
initiates N x M requests, where M is the total number of nodes.
This commit allows to update resources per specific node only.

Co-Authored-By: Yuriy Zveryanskyy (yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com)
Related-Bug: #1552446
Change-Id: Iffad4a6ab1aaa5fea591c19f6d330dc861c5675d

subject: Revert "Gate: fix AttributeError: load_pem_x509_csr"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 10:13:15.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/common/x509/test_sign.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Gate: fix AttributeError: load_pem_x509_csr"

Cryptography 1.3.1 has been released which closes this bug, meaning this
patch can now be reverted. As the problem has now been fixed.

https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2844 is now closed.

This reverts commit a75b5fb77aa7fc6900296800c9ea8e227e9abd39.

Change-Id: I387ff9fe099460f98303cf930b79db1632791ccd
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Gate: fix AttributeError: load_pem_x509_csr"

Cryptography 1.3.1 has been released which closes this bug, meaning this
patch can now be reverted. As the problem has now been fixed.

https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2844 is now closed.

This reverts commit a75b5fb77aa7fc6900296800c9ea8e227e9abd39.

Change-Id: I387ff9fe099460f98303cf930b79db1632791ccd

commit_message:
libvirt: Comment non-obvious security implications of migrate code

There are 2 lines in finish_migration which look like a bug. The
original reason for adding them no longer exists, but removing them
now would open a severe security bug due to a series of non-obvious
interactions. This patch simply adds a comment to ensure this is taken
into consideration when changing this code in future.

Change-Id: Icfe4b5deadfe7dbb0f34ea9af1f95b62cfca8a0a
(cherry picked from commit 61b34ed9a4030e44f6ae26e9326888d47aeb53df)

Since introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
running unit tests fails unless pylxd is installed on the system. This
is likely an unwanted dependency as it is problematic for distributions
that do not include LXD and which will not therefore distribute a
packaged version of pylxd.

This commit skips the lxd unit tests if pylxd cannot be imported.

Change-Id: Ic024d5295d26979c4c88b864b1589abd024ef405
Closes-bug: #1553280
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unconditional pylxd unit test dependency

Since introduction of the LXD/LXC first-party manila driver [1],
running unit tests fails unless pylxd is installed on the system. This
is likely an unwanted dependency as it is problematic for distributions
that do not include LXD and which will not therefore distribute a
packaged version of pylxd.

This commit skips the lxd unit tests if pylxd cannot be imported.

Change-Id: Ic024d5295d26979c4c88b864b1589abd024ef405
Closes-bug: #1553280

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-03 16:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_snapshot_manage.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Use get_by_args instead of host_and_topic

The replication v2.1 code (cheesecake) requires a number
of service queries.  The default by_host_and_topic however
doesn't include an interface to get disabled services which
is required at times.

Rather than adding a new version of get_by_host_and_topic and
introduce the arg, we probably shouldn't have been using this
particular query at all.  The only service we're interested in
is the cinder-volume service, granted in most cases volume_topic
is set to this as a default but we shouldn't be relying on it.

This patch changes the get_by_host_and_topic to use the more
appropriate (in this case) get_by_args and specifically requests
the cinder-volume binary.

Note that for manage_existing, we check the resturned service and
ensure that it disabled == False, otherwise we raise an exception.

Change-Id: I2e8c5142c589af6c1ddadeb661f86e7194faac7a
Closes-Bug: #1552006
"}]
commit_message:
Use get_by_args instead of host_and_topic

The replication v2.1 code (cheesecake) requires a number
of service queries.  The default by_host_and_topic however
doesn't include an interface to get disabled services which
is required at times.

Rather than adding a new version of get_by_host_and_topic and
introduce the arg, we probably shouldn't have been using this
particular query at all.  The only service we're interested in
is the cinder-volume service, granted in most cases volume_topic
is set to this as a default but we shouldn't be relying on it.

This patch changes the get_by_host_and_topic to use the more
appropriate (in this case) get_by_args and specifically requests
the cinder-volume binary.

Note that for manage_existing, we check the resturned service and
ensure that it disabled == False, otherwise we raise an exception.

Change-Id: I2e8c5142c589af6c1ddadeb661f86e7194faac7a
Closes-Bug: #1552006

commit_message:
neutron: pci_request logic considers 'direct-physical' vnic type

Since the following change:

If1ab969c2002c649a3d51635ca2765c262e2d37f

Neutron supports this vnic type, which ties in with the work that
enabled PF passthrough.

This patch makes sure to properly translate the 'direct-physical'
vnic-type port from Neutron to a request for a PF.

Change-Id: I51af36fc2edca3404a8f9efb32462f3680944be1
Partially-Implements: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port

Actually metering will only use the filter table. Nat table is not required.
But in currently implementation. Metering will initialize the nat table which
will make the rules in POSTROUTING chain in incorrect order.
Set state_less=True when metering initialize IptableManager to stop this behavior.

Change-Id: I91f5d1e5c5f2a220c06f500c091dd3867e0c3e99
Close-Bug: #1430003
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent neutron-metering-agent from updating iptables nat table

Actually metering will only use the filter table. Nat table is not required.
But in currently implementation. Metering will initialize the nat table which
will make the rules in POSTROUTING chain in incorrect order.
Set state_less=True when metering initialize IptableManager to stop this behavior.

Change-Id: I91f5d1e5c5f2a220c06f500c091dd3867e0c3e99
Close-Bug: #1430003

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for Share Replication

By default, these tests are disabled; 3rd party CI systems
should enable these tests through the
RUN_MANILA_REPLICATION_TESTS environment variable
if their driver supports share replication.

Partially implements: blueprint manila-share-replication
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthamr@netapp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Kerr <andrew.kerr@netapp.com>

Change-Id: Idaf3c61600337cc30568b982dfb23948209c1d6e

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-03-24 15:46:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.rst'], 'message': 'Add common capabilities matrix to devref

Add a new matrix to the share backends feature support mapping page
in the developer reference to indicate which backends support which
common capabilities, such as QoS and Thin Provisioning.

The Driver Handles Share Servers capabilities I retrieved from the
share creation column earlier in the same page. Other common
capabilities are currently filled in with information gathered from
the _update_share_stats() methods for each driver.

Change-Id: I5dfff0a62c91a047fc142018ece5f65edab3866a
'}]
commit_message:
Add common capabilities matrix to devref

Add a new matrix to the share backends feature support mapping page
in the developer reference to indicate which backends support which
common capabilities, such as QoS and Thin Provisioning.

The Driver Handles Share Servers capabilities I retrieved from the
share creation column earlier in the same page. Other common
capabilities are currently filled in with information gathered from
the _update_share_stats() methods for each driver.

Change-Id: I5dfff0a62c91a047fc142018ece5f65edab3866a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-01 17:19:24.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml'], 'message': 'Workaround ansible bug related to delegate_to

Currently the delegate_to doesnt happen and the neutron role creation is
attempted once on the first server and is skipped. The re-ordering of hosts in
site.yml seems to make the first host to be one inside neutron-server group
yielding the expected results. This patch needs to be re-visited as soon as a
version of ansible is chosen that fixes the issues with delegate_to

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Potter <nathaniel.potter@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ganesh Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ia712b323aa9d750d470a11ee899ab1b3054a903f
Partial-Bug: #1546789
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround ansible bug related to delegate_to

Currently the delegate_to doesnt happen and the neutron role creation is
attempted once on the first server and is skipped. The re-ordering of hosts in
site.yml seems to make the first host to be one inside neutron-server group
yielding the expected results. This patch needs to be re-visited as soon as a
version of ansible is chosen that fixes the issues with delegate_to

Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Potter <nathaniel.potter@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ganesh Mahalingam <ganesh.mahalingam@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ia712b323aa9d750d470a11ee899ab1b3054a903f
Partial-Bug: #1546789

commit_message:
Make keepalived virtual_router_id param configurable

To be kolla deploy multiple clouds, we need to be able to configure
virtual_router_id other wise haproxy will fail setup the VIP for the
second cloud.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiple-cloud
Closes-Bug: #1564547
Change-Id: I9eb27dd6fba61205841eadafc96601e235d2fe6d

commit_message:
Make Neutron stadium as inclusive as it can be

It makes no sense to keep Neutron and Nova separate, these two
projects should really be handled as one, and thus I think Nova
should be part of the Neutron stadium.

This will solve the stadium evolution conondrum for good.

Change-Id: Iaefeb3c6322188e10a8632c9a27088172760d2c7

commit_message:
libvirt: fix ivs test to use the ivs vif object

One of the ivs vif tests was mistakenly using the vif_ovs object.
The test still worked by pure luck.

commit_message:
libvirt: pass a real instance object into vif plug/unplug methods

When testing the vif plug/unplug methods we pass in None for the
instance parameter. This happens to succeed by luck, but when
converted to os-vif this will fail. Pass a real instance object
into the methods.

Change-Id: Ib24173130ac455e094dff940b14fc02b1b0a0dc8

commit_message:
Base for keystone tempest plugin

This patch adds the basic files and configs in order to enable the
keystone tempest plugin interface using tempest-plugin-cookiecutter.
Since we are adding them inside keystone's repository, they can be
installed alongside keystone and to run the tests (when we have one)
we simply use `testr run keystone_tempest_plugin` in tempest.

For more details about the tempest plugin interface see [1]

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html

Change-Id: Ia42e79246251e8af1010aa8eaf462aacf75644a7
Partially-Implements: bp keystone-tempest-plugin-tests

commit_message:
Update cells blacklist regex for test_server_basic_ops

Tempest change 9bee3b92f1559cb604c8bd74dcca57805a85a97a
renamed a test in our blacklist so update the filter to
handle the old and new name.

The Tempest team is hesitant to revert the change so we
should handle it ourselves and eventually move to using
test uuids for our blacklist, but there might need to
be work in devstack-gate for that first.

Conflicts:
        devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the regex using
wildcards still in liberty, that was changed in mitaka.

Change-Id: Ibab3958044c21568d7fbbe0a298bb40bbbc20df3
Closes-Bug: #1562323
(cherry picked from commit e86b7fbb99de0c4cff6a9569f748bae1bde693a6)

subject: Remove Django template warning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 09:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_catalog/settings.py'], 'message': 'Remove Django template warning

In 1.9 version of Django, following warning
appears when loading any page:

RemovedInDjango110Warning: You haven't defined a TEMPLATES setting.
You must do so before upgrading to Django 1.10.
Otherwise Django will be unable to load templates.
  "unable to load templates.", RemovedInDjango110Warning)

From 1.8 version, template settings in Django are set with the TEMPLATE property,
see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/ref/templates/upgrading/#the-templates-settings

This patch allows app-catalog to be forward compatible with django 1.9.

Change-Id: I2a0503c6031428f48a14558af7543b5bd77ac6b3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Django template warning

In 1.9 version of Django, following warning
appears when loading any page:

RemovedInDjango110Warning: You haven't defined a TEMPLATES setting.
You must do so before upgrading to Django 1.10.
Otherwise Django will be unable to load templates.
  "unable to load templates.", RemovedInDjango110Warning)

From 1.8 version, template settings in Django are set with the TEMPLATE property,
see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/ref/templates/upgrading/#the-templates-settings

This patch allows app-catalog to be forward compatible with django 1.9.

Change-Id: I2a0503c6031428f48a14558af7543b5bd77ac6b3

benchmarking OpenStack.

remove them.

commit_message:
Remove unintended exposure of private attribute

GaneshaNASHelper has a class attribute confrx that is
currently coded up as a public variable. This was unintended.

Made the following changes to fix this:
1. The variable name was updated from confrx to _confrx
per pep8 guidelines for defining non-public variables and instances.
2. All references to this variable have been updated.

Depends-On: Id7d43dee256856062bd0dadad9c469c1500ee36e
Change-Id: Ie4fe96cd9cf9f0ea281c94f5c1378b255f60bada
Co-Authored-By: Andrea Ma <ayma@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andrei Ta <ata@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Rowden <mrrowden@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1551497

+1

Change-Id: I2465d71dd4753bdd66539ee92cdf13f49aa7ed13

subject: Increase database connections to 10000
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 21:08:45.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/mariadb/templates/galera.cnf.j2'], 'message': 'Increase database connections to 10000

Scale limit testing on a 64 node cluster with 13 TB RAM and 2600
cores showed that atleast 1800 database connections are required
to appropriately start 2000 virtual machines simulateounsly.  Other
documentation on the internet recommends larger values such as 8000,
so we set to a larger value that should be able to handle a maxed out
512GB ram per compute node cluster with all services enabled.

Change-Id: I8767cf3fb04e066cc22e796c647e944b4e4a1742
Closes-Bug: #1564275
(cherry picked from commit 1fac190cec3c628c8a4c745659fcec090d952abd)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase database connections to 10000

Scale limit testing on a 64 node cluster with 13 TB RAM and 2600
cores showed that atleast 1800 database connections are required
to appropriately start 2000 virtual machines simulateounsly.  Other
documentation on the internet recommends larger values such as 8000,
so we set to a larger value that should be able to handle a maxed out
512GB ram per compute node cluster with all services enabled.

Change-Id: I8767cf3fb04e066cc22e796c647e944b4e4a1742
Closes-Bug: #1564275
(cherry picked from commit 1fac190cec3c628c8a4c745659fcec090d952abd)

subject: [Reports] Fix calc of running iterations in parallel
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 12:48:20.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/processing/charts.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_charts.py'], 'message': "[Reports] Fix calc of running iterations in parallel

Load profile chart is calulated wrongly.
It shows more running interations in parallel than actually
are running.

We are spliting all duration to 100 segments, and we
are adding +1 to each segment that has intersection
with segment (iter_start, iter_end).

Basically if we have 3 iterations with next timestamps
(1, 2.5), (2, 3) (2.5, 4)
and chart of next segments [(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4)]
we will get result as [1, 3, 1] instead of [1,2,1]
which is expected

This patch changes algorithm of calculation of parallel
running iterations, which is way simpler.

If chart segment is fully inside iteration segment +1,
If chart segment is partially inside iteration segment +0.5
(we don't need to calulate actually part of chart segment
 in iteration segment, because of the nature of data)

Co-Authored-By: Boris Pavlovic <boris@pavlovic.me>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie12b0d7293cf97b4bdc13aea436854475cbdba36
"}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Fix calc of running iterations in parallel

Load profile chart is calulated wrongly.
It shows more running interations in parallel than actually
are running.

We are spliting all duration to 100 segments, and we
are adding +1 to each segment that has intersection
with segment (iter_start, iter_end).

Basically if we have 3 iterations with next timestamps
(1, 2.5), (2, 3) (2.5, 4)
and chart of next segments [(1, 2), (2, 3), (3, 4)]
we will get result as [1, 3, 1] instead of [1,2,1]
which is expected

This patch changes algorithm of calculation of parallel
running iterations, which is way simpler.

If chart segment is fully inside iteration segment +1,
If chart segment is partially inside iteration segment +0.5
(we don't need to calulate actually part of chart segment
 in iteration segment, because of the nature of data)

Co-Authored-By: Boris Pavlovic <boris@pavlovic.me>
Co-Authored-By: Alexander Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie12b0d7293cf97b4bdc13aea436854475cbdba36

commit_message:
test: use real UUID in all UUID fields

Many of the fields in VIF related objects required a UUID, but
tests are passing in random garbage. The UUIDField is going to
start rejecting these bogus UUIDs so they need fixing

Closes-Bug: #1550629
Change-Id: I8ccc68a6f6e709951ae1ba6c1388d6c025775332

subject: test: add workaround for non-deterministic ovo object comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 13:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['os_vif/tests/test_vif.py'], 'message': 'test: add workaround for non-deterministic ovo object comparison

The ComparableVersionedObject impl of the __eq__ method incorrectly
checks the list of changed fields in an object. The ordering of
this list depends on the python hash seed, which causes the test
to randomly fail. Reset the list of changes as a workaround until
the ovo bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I438b4038308ad5f4af3c9055cda593f21ad7b654
'}]
commit_message:
test: add workaround for non-deterministic ovo object comparison

The ComparableVersionedObject impl of the __eq__ method incorrectly
checks the list of changed fields in an object. The ordering of
this list depends on the python hash seed, which causes the test
to randomly fail. Reset the list of changes as a workaround until
the ovo bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I438b4038308ad5f4af3c9055cda593f21ad7b654

Preserve existing environment when adding JAVA ppa

preserve the proxy settings in the existing environment.

subject: Fix the nova reconfigure in the multinode env
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-01 21:36:40.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/tasks/do_reconfigure.yml'], 'message': "Fix the nova reconfigure in the multinode env

Checking the fix condition first in the when clause rather than the
dynamic condition. Otherwise it will raise issue, especially in
multinode env.

For example use

  when:
    - nova_console == 'novnc'
    - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-novncproxy']

rather than

  when:
    - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-novncproxy']
    - nova_console == 'novnc'

Because the nova-novncproxy groups may do not exist.

Change-Id: I1e76ee239908a17a4c2ffd9a18c570fbc485172e
Closes-Bug: #1563643
(cherry picked from commit 792e2c1f26de6782879eefdccfcce242c35dff80)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the nova reconfigure in the multinode env

Checking the fix condition first in the when clause rather than the
dynamic condition. Otherwise it will raise issue, especially in
multinode env.

For example use

  when:
    - nova_console == 'novnc'
    - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-novncproxy']

rather than

  when:
    - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-novncproxy']
    - nova_console == 'novnc'

Because the nova-novncproxy groups may do not exist.

Change-Id: I1e76ee239908a17a4c2ffd9a18c570fbc485172e
Closes-Bug: #1563643
(cherry picked from commit 792e2c1f26de6782879eefdccfcce242c35dff80)

commit_message:
Reduce log errors from heka

Heka depends on haproxy and keepaived being present to communicate
with ElasticSearch.  If we start ElasticSearch prior to haproxy and
keepalived, the number of errors are reduced in heka.

Change-Id: Id2c742ea572c6450a371421e21f34aa69355bb8b
Partial-Bug: #1560779
(cherry picked from commit 0d2591dc30ac4d7c53b03d77006623a2162509fd)

subject: Rolling upgrades for Ceph Monitor Cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 15:09:03.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph.py', 'hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_upgrade_roll.py', '.gitignore', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py'], 'message': "Rolling upgrades for Ceph Monitor Cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph monitor cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster itself as a locking mechanism and only allows 1 ceph monitor
at a time to upgrade.  If a monitor has been waiting on the previous
server for more than 10 minutes and hasn't seen it finish it will
assume it died during the upgrade and proceed with its own upgrade.

Limitations of this patch: As long as the monitor cluster does not
split brain this should work fine.  Also this assumes that NTP
among the ceph cluster is fairly accurate.

Change-Id: I04e227ea0713f0eaa4b4d78ad856e3f06fa7f225
"}]
commit_message:
Rolling upgrades for Ceph Monitor Cluster

This change adds functionality to allow the ceph monitor cluster to
upgrade in a serial rolled fashion.  This will use the ceph monitor
cluster itself as a locking mechanism and only allows 1 ceph monitor
at a time to upgrade.  If a monitor has been waiting on the previous
server for more than 10 minutes and hasn't seen it finish it will
assume it died during the upgrade and proceed with its own upgrade.

Limitations of this patch: As long as the monitor cluster does not
split brain this should work fine.  Also this assumes that NTP
among the ceph cluster is fairly accurate.

Change-Id: I04e227ea0713f0eaa4b4d78ad856e3f06fa7f225

subject: Fix IP resolve check for RabbitMQ on AIO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 21:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/rabbitmq/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Fix IP resolve check for RabbitMQ on AIO

On AIO installation we cannot assume that the public IP address
will be the first entry in "getent ahostsv4" result, because
it may be also a localhost address. To make this check positive
in AIO, we should look for the public IP in the whole output.

Change-Id: I1da7b95d7f00c7f87ff68ead46bf55fdea812599
Closes-Bug: 1564564
(cherry picked from commit 5aa2dcce3089d08a46175513fecb55ce91004769)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix IP resolve check for RabbitMQ on AIO

On AIO installation we cannot assume that the public IP address
will be the first entry in "getent ahostsv4" result, because
it may be also a localhost address. To make this check positive
in AIO, we should look for the public IP in the whole output.

Change-Id: I1da7b95d7f00c7f87ff68ead46bf55fdea812599
Closes-Bug: 1564564
(cherry picked from commit 5aa2dcce3089d08a46175513fecb55ce91004769)

subject: encrypt_data(): don't encode IV to base64
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 13:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/crypto_utils.py'], 'message': "encrypt_data(): don't encode IV to base64

Encoding the IV (Initialization vector) to base64 means that each
byte only contains 6 bits of entropy per byte, whereas an IV can
contain up to 8 bits of entropy of byte. The Crypto AES function
accepts any byte string for the IV.

Since the IV is included in the encrypted string (as a prefix of a
fixed size), this change is backward compatible. Data encrypted with
the old code is decodable with the old and with the new code.

Change-Id: I210a21b80599110309fb92b4670e7a5749e94756
"}]
commit_message:
encrypt_data(): don't encode IV to base64

Encoding the IV (Initialization vector) to base64 means that each
byte only contains 6 bits of entropy per byte, whereas an IV can
contain up to 8 bits of entropy of byte. The Crypto AES function
accepts any byte string for the IV.

Since the IV is included in the encrypted string (as a prefix of a
fixed size), this change is backward compatible. Data encrypted with
the old code is decodable with the old and with the new code.

Change-Id: I210a21b80599110309fb92b4670e7a5749e94756

subject: When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/keepalived.conf.j2'], 'message': 'When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together

When a node uses two physical interfaces for its two VIPs, these
physical interfaces should be tied together, so both VIPs will
be taken out of scheduling if either one fails.  Without this change,
if a request comes into one interface that needs access to the
second interface to process the request, the original request
unnecessarily fails.  Repeating this results in a black hole where
a failing server keeps getting new requests.

Change-Id: Ic51e6584c1fbda3eb7821cb47f759c77e562cc65
Closes-Bug: #1550455
'}]
commit_message:
When two interfaces are used for two VIPs, tie them together

When a node uses two physical interfaces for its two VIPs, these
physical interfaces should be tied together, so both VIPs will
be taken out of scheduling if either one fails.  Without this change,
if a request comes into one interface that needs access to the
second interface to process the request, the original request
unnecessarily fails.  Repeating this results in a black hole where
a failing server keeps getting new requests.

Change-Id: Ic51e6584c1fbda3eb7821cb47f759c77e562cc65
Closes-Bug: #1550455

commit_message:
Pre-release stable/mitaka ACLs

Set up (temporary) pre-release ACLs for the soon-to-be-created
stable/mitaka branches (only for managed projects following the
milestones-driven release model).

This will be reverted post-release as we let stable maintenance
teams take over control over stabel branches.

Change-Id: Ia284ecddc497fbee86dc17f9f0b9f7c07293626f

commit_message:
IBM XIV/DS8K: Implement Replication v2.1

This patch implements cinder Replication version 2.1 as proposed in
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/replication

The driver implements:
1. freeze_backend - notify the backend that it's frozen
2. thaw_backend - notify the backend that it's not frozen
3. host_failover - failover a backend to a secondary replication target

Also removed v1.0 and v2.0 functions

DocImpact
Change-Id: I50498180c63725ab0f524ff8d55952446800570f
Closes-Bug: #1543600
